Reviews.Title: “Nice welcome and nice services that i got in hotel, its very nice hotel, location, safe and stafs.”
Reviews.Author: adel8008
Reviews.Content: Nice welcome and nice services that i got in hotel, its very nice hotel, location, safe and stafs and spiceal welcome to mr. benyamin for nice comunication and frindly

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjwrome
Reviews.Content: You won't be disappointed staying at the Ferman. The personnel are very friendly, helpful and fun. The breakfast is ample and good. They have a fabulous terrace with view of the bosphorous on one side and the blue mosque, hagia sofia on the other. Unfortunately the weather wasn't warm enough to use the terrace but one could go up and enjoy the view. We were upgraded to the penthouse suite which has a 5 star view. It is a bit more expensive than some hotels in the area but their view is worth a lot. Very enjoyable and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, good value, friendly”
Reviews.Author: traintraveller07
Reviews.Content: We have stayed now at several good Sultanahmet area hotels and liked this one. Beware, there is at least one other hotel with the name "Ferman" included. This hotel is near but just enough away from main Sultanahmet old quarter dining and cafe spots, so it is quiet. The room we had on the top floor faced the Blue Mosque and had a terrace; the view out of our window and terrace was extraordinary and worth paying a bit extra for. There is a discount for payment in cash on arrival, which we did. Staff is very friendly and helpful, and they stored bags for us whilst we did a few days outside Istanbul. Breakfast is on a subterranean floor, and included a good choice of both hot and cold options. There are also first floor and minus one level rooms, caveat emptor. Rooms on one side face the sea. There is a terrace with great views and clement weather service. Our room was large, and everything worked. Steep sided bath/shower. Only issue for us was that the closet safe was not bolted to the closet so it was portable. I mentioned this to the staff but this was not addressed; they are undoubtedly right that things are generally very safe, but portability defeats the idea of a small room safe. All in all, a very good hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ferman Hotel DO NOT Book airport transfer"”
Reviews.Author: melanie b
Reviews.Content: Ferman Hotel location is perfect The staff are polite and very helpful. DO NOT arrange an transfer airport through them, the driver on our arrival was more than 1 Hour late and the driver on our return journey was 25 mins late and drove like a lunatic,checking the arrival time of another flight!! .Next door hotel Seraglio looked much better and was a bit cheaper. Rooms are absolutely not soundproof: could sleep only after last guests arrived and until first woke up. As if all doors were open The best thing about this hotel is the location, it's perfect for all of the tourist sights.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: betsysSacramento
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ferman for five days upon arrival in Turkey, and returned for another three nights before our departure, and highly recommend it. I stopped in at several of the top rated hotels in a similar price category ($145-$199/night) and found Ferman to be superior for the money. Special thanks to Adnan (jack-of-all-trades staff member) and Yasemin for making our stay special. We were sorry that Bunyamin left but were impressed with his replacement. Having spent that much time in Sultanhamet, I was also happy that we were on Amiral Taftil Sokak, which is a quiet, small street with five boutique hotels in a row. The parallel street once block up the hill toward the Blue Mosque is solid restaurants, with considerably more noise at night. Pluses: larger-than-typical rooms (we were in a double superior, first in room 306 and then in room 406), incredibly helpful staff, nice sitting area in the lobby, beautiful rooftop terrace with stunning view of the Blue Mosque, good breakfast spread. Our rooms had a small balcony overlooking the street. You need to be in the 400's to see the Blue Mosque over the trees. Suggestions: improve the lighting in the rooms, especially near the closet In case you're wondering, the name of the hotel refers to calligraphic signatures used by dignitaries and the sultan in Ottoman times; the hotel is decorated with reproductions of the sultan's tugra

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ferman Hotel was absolutely wonderful on all counts! The staff, the location and the facilities are all first-rate. The location is within walking distance to about everything you could want, and the side street is very quiet compared to the other hotel locations in Sultanahmet. Believe me, this is a great location and you are a block away from all the shops and restaurants. A highlight for us was the service we received from Advan (spelling?); he was at our beck and call the entire time and took care of us beyond the call of duty. You cannot go wrong with this hotel - top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Diane H
Reviews.Content: This was an outstanding hotel experience. When we arrived we were warmly greated at the hotel desk by Bunyamino. He and the hotel staff were excellent in providing information on tourist sites as well as authentic Istanbul sites of the locals. The hotel was comfortable, the room was quiet and immaculate, and we were given a room upgrade. I can't say enough about this wonderful experience. The hotel is close to many attractions and various transportation routes including the tram, train, subway, bus, and Bosphorous ferries. The hotel was also situated on a quiet street. There were two small food markets close at hand for items to take to the room (including breads, cheeses, figs, etc.). I highly recommend this hotel. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , let me say wonderful”
Reviews.Author: arhabn
Reviews.Content: Excellent service Best team of staff i have ever seen in one hotel, kind and professional They upgraded my room to one with great view of the Blue Mosque I recommend this hotel and would choose again definitely once i come back to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Sultanahmet Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexy d
Reviews.Content: Ferman Hotel has excellent staff & service, great place, lovely specious room... all Ingredients were there to make My stay just 1 night day stay in Istanbul very comfortable and enjoyable.Bunyamin Kaplan, who sat down with me and map and said â€œletâ€™s plan your time in Istanbulâ€�. He (and the rest of the staff) consistently gave us excellent suggestions & directions in very good english - they made it quite easy! Another stand-out was the guy Ferhit breakfast - friendly, Waking up on the center of old Istanbul makes you feel a bit more romantic it was dreamy. Historical/touristic center is only 5 min walk and there is a taxi stop near hotel t of the hotel entrance. All of the receptionists were so nice and recommended me exceptional places and a restaurant what you see what is danger. Ferman rooms are really very well equipped and furnished to make your stay as comfortable as at home. I certainly recommend this warm , lovely new hotel in Sultanahmet to all of you guys.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight Ferman”
Reviews.Author: kim k
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the FERMAN hotel Istanbul from the 22 March 2012 until the 25 march 2012. We loved it! The personal were all very helpful and excellent- in particular the man working at the front desk named Benjamin , we cant possibly be grateful enough for all of the information and help we received.Ferman Hotel is located in the popular and central location of Oldcity Easy walking distance to main attractions. The rooms at the Ferman are spacious and clean and the price is very reasonable. Thank you again to everyone at The Ferman for making our trip so memorable, we will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel at a reasonale price”
Reviews.Author: Juan A
Reviews.Content: An excellent, not very expensive hotel, clean, quiet, with the staff always at your disposal, always ready to help. Highly recommended. Walking distance from all the major sightseeing places of Istanbul. We had a room with an excellent view, and room itself was large and really nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price, location and kindly staff”
Reviews.Author: Patricia P
Reviews.Content: The Ferman hotel has an excellent location. In the roof terrace you can see very close the Bosphorous, the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and very beautiful with a balcony facing the Bosphorous. If we plan to go back to Istanbul for sure we will go to Ferman Hotel. Patricia & Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Ferman Hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: slsghaddar
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were friendly and professional. They helped me figure out the city map, where to eat etc... The hotel was lovely, spacious and clean. The breakfast was absolutely great and the breakfast room was very nice. I would recommend this hotel and plan to go back with my family next time. S.Ghaddar

Reviews.Title: “Very good price, location excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Kat F
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, maximum 5 min walking distance to Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Many restaurants and argile cafe around the hotel. The tram station is 10 min walking. I think the location of this hotel, couldn't be better! The breakfast was complimentary from the hotel, many choices of juices, coffee, bread, sweets, etc... Very good quality and many choices! Our room was big, always clean and cozy. Even though it was in the ground floor in front of the reception it was quiet. Everything was excellent, but I must mention that the most valuable part of that hotel is the staff. 24/7 there for us ready to help us and advise us about anything! Extremely friendly all of them, especially Benjamin and Yasemin very professional and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: mohamed a
Reviews.Content: Ferman Hotel is in a great location set in the old town very close to all the main tourist locations.Romm is very clean,very good choice for breakfast and is very close toTurkish IslamÄ±c Art Museum .Would like to mention the hotel staff who are all very Friendly and could not do more to make your stay enjoyable.A special mention to Bunyamin and Yasemin two of the front desk staff they were so charming.I would highly recommend Ferman hotel to all travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: leo88copper
Reviews.Content: Last June was our first trip to Turkey and the Ferman Hotel was our first stop. The minute we checked in we knew our vacation in Turkey will be a good one! The staff are helpful and very friendly. I was allergic to the aromatic smell of comforter. After I told the staff, our room was clear of any aromatic smell during our stay (four nights). My son and I are very happy about the hotel and was puzzled to see the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “A Stay Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: bluemar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights while visiting my brother who was living in Istanbul for a couple of months. The hotel's driver was right on time and picked up the two of us from Ataturk airport. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by a warm smile from Yasemin. Our room was ready (we were a bit early) and right across from reception. Very large room (two twin beds and a seating area) and spotless. At the last minute we decided to have my brother stay with us for the four nights. Yasemin was quick to accommodate us and soon another member of the staff was making up the sofa bed. Breakfast was wonderful; cheeses, meats, cereal, eggs, bread and preserves, coffee, tea, and juices. Delicious and plentiful. During our stay Adnan made sure we had a great breakfast and was an absolute joy to talk to (even making sure that my mom had plenty of her favorite tea in our room). When we would return to the hotel from sightseeing, Sedat would greet us with a smile and really went above and beyond when we needed assistance. The entire staff was wonderful and always smiling, including the housekeeping ladies who kept our room perfect. This was by far the best experience I have had at a hotel (US and Europe) in a very long time. Great location and an outstanding staff made for a extraordinary vacation!

Reviews.Title: “2 adults + 1 little boy: perfect!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sere_Nicky
Reviews.Content: It is not a big building but a beautuful little hotel in the heart of Istanbul in a tipica area. 2 minutes walk from the main attractions.All around there are loads of restaurants so you dont need to take a taxi to have dinner.The hotel is very clean and our room was huge. They gave us a very nice baby cot for my son. All this make the hotel excellent but what really make the difference is the staff, they were very helpfull and nice with us and simply amazing with my baby. There is the train close to the hotel but it's close to any hotel aroun there and it wasnt a problem during the night (probabily coz the bed is so confortable!!!!) If you make a reservation writing to the hotel you have some extra services and if you pay by cash you also have 10% discount I would definitely advice this hotel to everyone!! thank you very much guys!!!! Serena Davide and the little NICOLO'

Reviews.Title: “Super nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: caryn1958
Reviews.Content: Great location as a home base in Istanbul for all major sites. Great breakfast with views of the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zuff
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul in early December 2011 and stayed at Ferman Hotel for 3 nights. There isn't any better word to describe this hotel than just SUPERB. The receptionist was really really nice and friendly. Upon arrival we were greeted very very warmly and we were served with tea, turkish delight and some cookies. The hotel room was nice. Breakfast was served every morning and you can choose to have breakfast in your own room! You just need to give them a call the night before to inform them. The location was very near to the blue mosque and everything else is just within walking distance. I like everything about this hotel and if I ever go to Istanbul again, I'll definitely stay at this hotel again. The price is not that expensive either. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: gghione
Reviews.Content: On December 2011 I've spent 5 nights at Ferman Hotel with my girlfriend, and I can say without hesitation that this has been a wonderful experience. The hotel is in such a perfect position (300 meters from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia) that you can easily forget buses, metro or taxis... and count only on your feet; the area is safe and never scary, even during the night, as the hotel is surrounded by nice restaurants and cafÃ¨. We booked via expedia the Ferman Room (the small one): it was clean, with typical Ottoman furniture and good sized for the prize we payed. Other important feature: all the members of the staff were very kind and helpful, without being too intrusive. We couldn't have breakfast in the terrace because of the whether but the view from there looks terrific. I'd definitely recommend it to every tourist, and if I'll ever visit Istanbul for sure I will sleep again at Ferman Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Its a great pleasure to stay at the Ferman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: outtasighte
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 11 days in Istanbul, where I had to good fortune to select the Ferman Hotel. I was there with 4 friends. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, including Yasemin and George at the front desk, and Adnan, a porter who also was responsible for the delicious and generous breakfasts. For most of the stay, we were the only guests at the Ferman, so it was very quiet. The Ferman is well situated in the SultanAhmet area. Any questions we had were promptly answered and the many recommendations (restaurants, tourist sites, hamams) were helpful, even occasionally brilliant. The hotel was not expensive. As I mentioned, the breakfasts were generous. A plate of fresh cookies and Turkish delight always sat in the lobby, along with umbrellas to borrow in inclement weather. The showers were hot and strong, the beds comfortable and the rooms clean. We are definitely staying there again on her next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and great comfort”
Reviews.Author: Jess W
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul after the tourist season; the city was quiet. The staff at the Ferman hotel made sure that we had an amazing time and there kindness and knowledge made our trip a huge success!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FERMAN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: constantinepolis25
Reviews.Content: We Made Reservation on a Hotel Ferman website. But no one talked of Orient Express train tracks right behind hotel so every 20 minutes you have to enjoy good noise in room.If can sleep with Noise around you are welcome there. My room was directly off the main lobby with the reception area, the stairs and lift right on our doorstep. We could hear every conversation and all the guests coming and Going you do not mind dirty Kilim l go there.no free welcome drink or fruit basket no free parking Tried to Explain the discrepancy to the Hotel manager SERTHAN . Firts he promised to solve the problem and at the end of our stay he behaved really rude and blamed with unfriendly mood (!!!). So we had to pay for the parking 10Liras perdays ..Only saving grace was LOCATION We have travelled the world and stayed in hundreds of different accommodations but the Ferman wins the prize for the Ferman Hotel we have ever encountered. Look elsewhere as there are plenty of nice lux hotel in the Sultanahmet Area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: AKND
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service. Incredibly friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable and clean.Great location and view from the roof top. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “â€œdefinitely not what we want ...â€�”
Reviews.Author: milene h
Reviews.Content: Its Inexpensive hostel .We didn't expect so much. The location is the best, you can walk from the hotel to the main attractions: Turkish hamam , Sultanahmet , Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia , Spice Bzaar Medusa Cistern ) The service was very friendly and helpful. The cleanliness.. well, that wasn't that good. Anyway, my overall view is good

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric Location”
Reviews.Author: Neil W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ferman from the 26028 November. The hotel is in a quiet area of Sultanhamet. An area that I found quite charming but others looking for lively night life might be disappointed. Be aware that this is not a typical international business oriented 5 star chain hotel. The hotel is smallâ€”as are most of the hotels in the areaâ€”in a way again I found charming but others, again might be disappointed. I found the room to be clean, tidy and to have a distinctive character I liked. The bathroom was clean and well equipped. I did not use the internet, although there was free wireless. The hotel TV channel options were very limited so donâ€™t expect CNN and a host of western movie channels. Breakfast was my least pleasurable experience as it is in the basement with little atmosphere and limited choice. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly throughout my stay. This was off season so I was lucky and they put me in a corner room with a balcony that had an excellent view of the blue mosque. I set my alarm for 6am so I could go out and explore early, however I neednâ€™t have bothered as there is a cultural â€œmorning callâ€� (to prayer) at 6am. For me personally this added to the romantic atmosphere with the Blue Mosque in sight but be warned it is loud and it might disturb some. In short, if youâ€™re not expecting a 5 star business hotel experience then this is a charming hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “just Location”
Reviews.Author: jesus a
Reviews.Content: We was been Ferman Hotel from 8 -13November Don't forget a TUrkia dictionaire when you travel to Estambul Rooms are really Minil, but very clean, free WIFI only oke in the Breakfast sallon , in the rooms not signal , Breakfast very good but typcial Turkish food, nothing Western , could be much better. We've had a room in the 5.floor, with a small balcony .AC was Weak and noisy at night a loud impossible to sleep.Our room was also noisy as it faced theOrient Express tram Line with the tram. I Will not recommend Ferman hotel particularly not for couple or familliar..Dont go Ferman

Reviews.Title: “Overall Experience Very Good”
Reviews.Author: gautamani
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples from India who stayed from 10th thru 12th November 2011 We stayed in rooms 302 & 401 both of which had great views of the Sea of Marmara. The rooms are 5 star hotel in size and are clean and the toilets excellent The only problem with the rooms facing the Sea of Marmara is the Rail line in front which can be quite disturbing in the day, but who stays in the room in the day!In the night this is hardly noticeable . The location is just fantastic as it is just a stones throw away from the Blue Mosque, The Sofia Mosque and other historic sites in the Sultan Mehmet area. There are plenty of very good eating places within 5 minutes walking distance , The staff are very helpful and all understand and speak sufficient English We would make particular mention of Yasmine in the front desk One negative side is the breakfast which is rather spartan although good Strongly recommended Boutique Hotel Gautam Mani

Reviews.Title: “Great service and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Courtney G
Reviews.Content: We have a sizable room and the hotel is located in a great location if you want to see all the historic sites in Istanbul. The service was wonderful and helped arrange for a turkish bath and tours during the day. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel walking distance to all in old city!!!”
Reviews.Author: SeaCoral7
Reviews.Content: Ferman Hotel had a helpful friendly English speaking staff. Nice clean rooms with wood floors and tiled bathrooms. Roof top had an amazing 360 degree view of the Blue Mosque and Bosphorours. Good full breakfast buffet roof top and drinks served at roof top bar. Try and stay in upper level rooms. No view from bottom rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yardlie
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in this country; and this hotel was perfectly located; very clean and excellent service; I would love to go back there for sure;and if you have a chance try the Metropolis restaurant excellent food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but pre-check your booking”
Reviews.Author: RStuff
Reviews.Content: Very good and comfortable hotel in great location for sight-seeing. We booked two â€œsuperiorâ€� rooms on Holidays.com and got a much better price than the hotel direct - however one couple were allocated a suite room with water view (which was fantastic) and the other a small room under street level (which was very noisy and not a good sleep). Hotel management appear to allocate rooms based on short term schedule rather than what was booked. The hotel staff were responsive and did what they could to rectify the situation and the second couple were allocated a better room after the first night. This didnâ€™t appear to be an isolated incident as we heard another guest who had booked through an on-line broker arguing with the reception staff about rooms. Breakfast buffet was excellent and there is a great view from the restaurant rooftop. We were overall happy with the stay but if we stayed again, we would check and re-check before we arrived what type of room we would be given.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: W R P
Reviews.Content: Found all the Staff to be outstanding. Yesmine was delightful as all of her fellow service people Hotel was clean and well kept. Roof top patio was delightful Great location

Reviews.Title: “â€œDisappointing Hotel Tiny Room â€�”
Reviews.Author: elisa_mayer
Reviews.Content: Ferman Hotel Probably the most awful experiance that i've had in any developing country's hotel and trust me i've stayed in a fair fewThe location is Brillant , but we were given a dark room - definitely the smallest hotel room of our whole life. We obviously tried to change it, but it proved impossible.We (2 single females). The staff was Just OK - no more and nobody could speak English inc front desk . A little too pushy when they tried to send us to have dinner at their friends' restaurant (pretending they were just suggesting the best fish restaurant in Kumkapi). Pick-up service from the airport worked well, 25$ a correct fare. Breakfast OK, the best thing was the spectacular view on the rooftop terrace, but food just correct, I would NOT rate it delicious. Blue Mosgue is just a 200 meters away, you can experience the thrill of a muezzin calling people to pray with very very loud loudspeakers at 6 o'clock in the morning - it is just as if he was in your room. a conveniently located budget hotel, some of the rooms can be OK only for very skinny people travelling with a small bag; the staff is helpful, but you'd better take some of their indications with a pinch of salt All in all very disappointing and we wouldn't recommend it due to the unfriendly satff and its location which is quite intimidating, patricularly for US Costumer .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: rreynolds5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five wonderful nights at the Ferman Hotel in mid-September. This is our second visit to Istanbul and again, we had a very pleasurable stay in the city. The hotel is within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions and public transportation. The room was perfect- very clean and well furnished. The service was excellent and personalized. The hotelâ€™s staff was always friendly, helpful, and courteous. The hotel arranged for a driver to meet us at the airport; our flight was two hours late and I was worried the driver would not be there when we cleared customs. He did wait and I was pleasantly surprised. After traveling for 23 hours, he made out trip from the airport to the hotel relaxing and enjoyable â€“ no stress. The hotel has a nice rooftop breakfast with a great view of the Bosporus, Blue Mosque, and Hagia Sophia. In the evening, we would have drinks on the rooftop and the view was even more spectacular. We had a wonderful experience visiting Istanbul and staying in the Ferman Hotel. I have nothing but positive comments for this hotel and its wonderful staff and would recommend it to anyone. We are planning to return to Istanbul again next year and we will definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing (Oct 2011 stay)”
Reviews.Author: hana1980
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very good for sightseeing and it was clean. The breakfast on the other hand was the worst I have had in all my many years of staying in hotels week after week. It was always cold, not very Turkish, a large selection of cold meats and cheeses filled most of the breakfast table, items would frequently be unavailable. The hotel did not have half of the facilities it boasted on Expedia, and definitely not a 4 star, it is no more than a 3 star. The view we had was that of a shack and a very loud railway line behind. The rooms are not soundproof as they are advertised. They have not just elevated the status hotel, but actually lied about the details and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: few_words
Reviews.Content: After having reviewed almost all the hotels in Sultanahmet/Sirkeci area, we decided on Ferman Hotel based on the reviews. We stayed in Room 401, double room with ocean view. First, the room is much bigger than what you would typically find in Istanbul and/or Europe. The luxuorious, spacious feel of the room along with the sea view was definitely a pleasant experience. The early Oct weather being rainy and cold, we felt very content to enjoy the seaview with a cup of hot tea! For breakfast,the roof restaurant offered spectacular views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Marmara Sea crowded with ships, ferries, etc. Unfortunately, the weather was not very colloborative in that it was rainy, windy and cold. We would have wanted to spend hours for breakfast and after dinner if the weather were nicer. Similar to other hotels in Turkey, we weren't surprised with the uninteresting breakfast. I mean one would expect local breakfast items with a broader selection but by the time we stayed at this hotel, we came to accept that in Turkey most hotels have very limited breakfast selection. Couldn't understand why. Another nuisance was the transportation back to the airport. Like any other business in the Sultanahmet area, the taxi arranged by the hotel was twice as much as expensive as you would arrange otherwise. As with the restaurants, gift shops, etc. try to negotiate the transportation into half of what's offered by the hotel. While it certainly is not the best, overall, we would highly recommend this hotel because of great location, very comfortable rooms, excellent seaview and overall good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ferman Hotel excellent”
Reviews.Author: rogersteadman28
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ferman Hotel in Istanbul for a week in early September this year. We found the location perfect being right next to the main tourist sites, and many restaurants. Reception were always very helpful. Our room was pleasant, tidy and comfortable. The roof terrace restaurant where we had breakfast has the most spectacular views to the Blue Mosque, over the Bosphorus and the Sea of Mamara. We thoroughyl enjoyed our stay and we unhesitatinlgy recommend it. Roger & Lynne

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill C
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very clean and a super location. Erican and Veyjel at reception were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: perthtravellor
Reviews.Content: Ferman is set in a lovely building on a cobble stoned street only 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and other must see Istanbul attractions. Our room, on the first floor looking at the Bosphorus was large by typical European standards, sunny and well appointed. Wood floors, along with lovely textiles and lamps give an authentic feel. The roof terrace is a real attraction, both for a pre or post dinner drink and breakfast. Beware the birds who will snap up your bread!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Steph H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ferman hotel from Christmas to New Year's 2010/2011. The hotel is small, but nice. The staff was wonderful and gave us lots of recommendations for things to do over our 10 day stay. The location is within walking distance of a lot of great restaurants and sites. We had no problem walking to the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazaar. The breakfast at the hotel was pretty good. Rooms aren't huge by any standards but they are more than adequate. There is a train that runs nearby the hotel but it was not too loud when the balcony door was closed. We did have a maintenance issue with the toilet in our room which was leaking. The hotel maintenance staff came and fixed the problem very quickly. The hotel could probably use some minor updating, but it is a great place to stay. One note on staying in Sultanahmet, it is very touristy. The next time I go back to Istanbul I will probably stay in the Galata or Beyoglu area as the quality of restaurants and nightlife is better in those areas.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Staff Great”
Reviews.Author: awesome4some
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights recently enroute to Bucharest via Hotels.com The hotels response to email was very efficient and quick and Adam picked me up at the airport in large Mercedes Van which was a freshing start to my holiday compared to the Taxis enroute. Although more expensive than a taxis at 50 Euros return, it was well worth it. I was met with a lovely warm welcome as the staff came out of the hotel to help with my luggage and I was upgraded to a junior suite, when I asked for a good view. It did look over the Bosphorus but there was a railway track between. The trains started early but I wasnt bothered by the noise especially as I spent most of my time sightseeing. The shower was amazing as was the location as it was approx 2 minutes from the Blue Mosque. I therefore save money on taxis as all the main sights were withing walking distance. The wifi was good and connected well. The view in the morning on the terrace for breakfast was worth the holiday as it was immediately infront of the Blue mosques and to the left of Aya Sophia. Some may however get disturbed by the early morning call to prayer.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: Sean O O
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 6 nights at the Ferman Hotel in September 2011. We came to Istanbul to see the historic sites and experience the modern City. The boutique hotel's offering is outstanding in almost every respect. The location is ideal. A few minutes walk from the principal historic sites (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica cistern etc.) and no more than 20 minutes to half an hour to walk to Eminonu port, Suleymaniye Mosque, Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar. If you stay at the Ferman, I would not recommend buying a public transport multi day ticket - you will have little need for trains, buses, trams or taxis. There is a choice of many restaurants in the immediate vicinity which is surprisingly quiet for such a central location. Our room was a "Sultan" room on the first floor. The view was limited but the room was excellent. Modern but decorated well in the Ottoman style. Room was spacious, with good ensuite facilities. The aircon was 100% efficient. Breakfast was taken on the roof with excellent views of the Blue Mosque and Sea of Marmara. The service was simply outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. I called the hotel a few days before we arrived and asked them to arrange airport transfers for us which they did at very reasonable rates. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anybody planning to visit Istanbul for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: maviRoma
Reviews.Content: we liked the hotel: location is great, st.sophia and blue mosque are both within walking distance. Staff is friendly and polite. rooms are clean and the terrace where breakfast is served has a great view of sultanhamet!would definitely recommend this hotel. thank you guys we had a great holiday. maria and roberto(from italy)

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you need in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Rutilante
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been a surprise. Of course, you will not have a business center or a swimming pool, but....you are on vacation!!!! The staff is the nicest I have seen in years....the location is right in the center of Sultanahmet, 5 minutes walking from Hagya Sophia, the Blue Mosque or Topkapi Palace, they will promise you a taxi in less than 2 minutes and you will have it!! The room is large enough, maybe a little bit dark, but it is about the decoration, no big deal. They provide every ammenity you can imagine... Plenty of restaurants and bars in the area.... When back in Turkey, for sure will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: dougalHorsham
Reviews.Content: What can I say???? From our reservation enquiries to the fabulous greeting we had on check in, The Ferman is truly a "Home away from Home". Our flight was held up by the largest queues in immigration that I have ever seen but our hotel driver was there to whisk us away to the Ferman and pure bliss. Erhan and Jasmine made our checkin a breeze, cold drinks, Turkish Delight and biscuits offered whilst paperwork was done. We were shown to our rooms, 503 and 504 on the 3rd floor and within minutes hot coffees were delivered to enjoy on our balconies whilst taking in breathtaking views of the Blue Mosque and Bosphorous. Can thoroughly recommend the Penthouse Rooms. Large, fabulous balconies and views to die for, lounge seating and really just very well equiped rooms for a 7 night stay. The only problem with our rooms and not one that would prevent us from staying here or in those rooms again was the moving of chairs around on the Roof Top Terrace from early morning until very late at night. As breakfast is served there from as early as 6.30am and used until very late as a bar area the terrace was in constant use and why not as the views from here were the best you would get anywhere. We ourselves used the bar everynight for Happy Hour where Memdu(sorry for spelling) would serve our drinks along with complimentary nuts and fresh fruit. Most times we just never moved on. As meals are not served in hotel, we were able to go out and bring food back and enjoy whilst having our drinks and just plain relaxing after extensive days of sightseeing beautiful Istanbul and touring both Gallipoli and cruising to the Black Sea. No need to get dressed up and go out, the hotel was fabulous for just about anything. All Staff were the friendliest, most helpful of any hotel I have been too. Nothing was any trouble and all requests were met efficiently and with the lovliest smiles. The rooms had tea coffee making facilities but tea and coffee were available all day on the terrace compliementary if you just needed to have one more photo or view of the outstanding Blue Mosque/Istanbul or Bosphorous. Amazing Erhan organized tours, private guides, airport transfers, irons etc. and there was not one thing we would have changed about any of it. If Erhan could have made it cooler (so hot in Instanbul in July) I think he would have tried. Istanbul is a fabulous city and along with the people make it an outstanding destination and of course where else would you stay but The Ferman. I would just like to congratulate ALL staff at the hotel for making our visit such a memorable one and would have quite happily stayed on as we became just so relaxed and although have only arrived home this morning am already missing our drinks sessions on the Terrace, coffees on our balcony and the best hotel in Istanbul. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: bunnifer
Reviews.Content: My husband thought I was a genius for finding such a great hotel for such a reasonable price. The decor is lovely...elegant, but not overdone. The bathroom was a decent size with very nice fixtures, etc. The staff was very helpful and knowledgable, and seemed genuinely interested in our enjoyment of the city. We had a room on the first floor just off the lobby. I thought at first this would be weird, but once we went on and closed the door, it was easy to forget how close the lobby was. The view out the window isn't great...back alley and railroad tracks, but you can't have everything! (The breakfast buffet was just adequate, but when you're used to breakfast buffets laden with biscuits and gravy and crispy bacon, anything else just doesn't cut it.)

Reviews.Title: “Did not stay here but their rooftop bar is the best!”
Reviews.Author: mrt77
Reviews.Content: Their rooftop terrace has a phenomenal view of the Blue Mosque and Golden Horn, and the service there is top notch. We would go there for drinks before dinner and they would keep bringing us complimentary appetizers! Our favorite bar in Istanbul. Did not stay in the hotel but it also looked very nice and impeccably clean.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get better than this, so look no further...”
Reviews.Author: Kimmethj
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Ferman Hotel. The Ferman is luscious, authentic (but modern), CLEAN, romantic and beautiful. A year ago when I decided to travel to Istanbul for the first time, I looked at and compared 43 different hotels. In the end we decided on the Ferman. AND, we could not have been luckier. The Ferman is right smack in the center of the 'Old Town' (which in my opinion is the ONLY place to stay in Istanbul)...Just around the corner from EVERYTHING (restaurants, Blue Mosque, Spice Market, etc...). Our top level King Suite faced the Blue Mosque, and WOW...it could not have been more beautiful if we designed the view ourselves. Even before we arrived in Istanbul we emailed SEVERAL questions and requests to the hotel. Everything, and I mean everything we asked, was arranged for us. We were picked up from the airport by a kind, safe driver. When we checked into the hotel the staff treated us as if we were returning home from a long trip. Erhan the Front Desk Manager is amazing!!! As we were often out late at night (and we were two women), he personally made restaurant reservations for us and guided us to and from places in the Old Town. In a nutshell, you could not make a better choice. While in Istanbul, we checked out many of the other hotels we considered. In the end, nothing could hold a candle to the overall comfort, beauty, service, and location of the Ferman Hotel. Treat yourself. You will not be sorry. Kim Jackson We always felt safe and looked after. Also, if you want to go rug shopping you must go to the Fairtrade Gallery. It was recommended to us by the Ferman staff and was by far the best experience we had in rug shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Laterooms 5* rating is misleading”
Reviews.Author: hingwy
Reviews.Content: This would have been a highly rated hotel if Laterooms had advertised it as 3* but it was rated as 5*, hence a disappointment. I will be very wary of laterooms ratings next time. Staff service was great and room was fine but would have been better with bedside table on both sides instead of 1. Breakfast was really poor quality food. Only 1 member of staff to manage the whole breakfast setup, fantastic guy but needed 2 more people, so lots of time on both days waiting for clean glasses and cups or for coffee machine refill. Food was dry and had birds constantly landing on the bread board. Fruit juice was unpleasant, dulited cordial. Wifi was so weak even google home page took 2 minutes to load (signal in room was dodgy on 1st floor but even using it by reception it was too slow to bother, morning and evening) - pointless to advertise you have Wifi. Reception staff agreed slow speed was normal. Good location near central attractions, quiet street and a lovely little boutique hotel but rating should have been 3* - even though it seems there are some very grand 5* suites within the hotel, these are not the ones allocated to laterooms customers.

Reviews.Title: “"The best choice in Sultanahmet"”
Reviews.Author: Zsolt_70
Reviews.Content: "The Hotel was very comfortable with very friendly staff. Great selection of breakfast. Breathtaking view from roof top terrace. One side is the Marmara Sea, the other one is the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. We strongly recommend this beautiful Boutique Hotel in the middle of the Sultan Ahmet district. This Hotel is a good value for money.â€�

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: happiesttravelers
Reviews.Content: the ferman hotel was an excellent choice, centrally located and pleasantly appointed, for a wonderful vacation in Istanbul. a highlight of the hotel was the superb attention and sage advice of the front desk manager, Erhan Topaloglu, who did everything possible to make our trip a success--thanks, Erhan! (Erhan also runs an excellent carpet and leather shop whose prices you can trust.)

Reviews.Title: “Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Elcraig
Reviews.Content: My wife Denise and I stayed at the Ferman Hotel in June, 2010. We stayed in Room 501 and I recommend that you do the same. First, the Sultanahmet District is very amenable to the refined adult taste. You walk out the door of the Ferman and you hit the beautiful cobblestone streets without any car traffic. This gives the tenant the immediate feeling for the homey nature of a neighborhood. This single feeling of ease cannot be over emphasized. You can walk through the neighborhood and get the Turkish hello, which is how they try to get you to buy their wares. Remember, Turks are very friendly, and as soon as you acknowledge their greeting in a friendly fashion, they change immediately from challenging to accommodating. In Room 501, you have a balcony overlooking the Marmara Sea. Off to the left, you can see the beginning of the Bosphorus, one of the most beautiful bodies of water on this planet. Take note of how the Golden Horn got its name. At night, retire up to the top floor (same place you enjoy an excellent breakfast each morning). You can throw a rock and hit the Blue Mosque. Off to the right, you can see Hagia Sofia. This is an excellent hotel, the service is solid, turkish delights are available always, the room is very good and the location is excellent. I recommend Room 501 without hesitation. You will not be disappointed, and you will love Istanbul. We did.

Reviews.Title: “The Ferman Hotel Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: PamGurdHughes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ferman Hotel for three nights prior to going on a cruise in May 2011. I emailed the hotel in advance for their advice on the best way to get from the airport to the hotel and they arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport. This was wonderful since we flew from Toronto, Ontario. The cost was a bit more than a taxi but the convenience was worth it. Our room was a beautiful suit on the main floor. The breakfast that was included in the price of the room was up on the roof terrace and the veiw was excellent. The breakfast was very different from what we have in North America; however, it was an interesting experience. The hotel staff was very friendly and everyone we encountered spoke English. The hotel location was very convenient so we could walk to many of the attractions, shopping areas, and restaurants. The people at the front desk were extremely helpful with directions and recommendations. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay in superbly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: eddieevano
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in late June/early July. Had a wonderful time, the hotel is very conveniently located for the blue mosque and the topkapi palace and has several great restaurants close by. The room was very clean and spacious the shower and bathroom was excellent. The staff were friendly and let us keep our room overtime for no extra cost and sorted airport transfers for us. It also has excellent free wifi. Great views from the terrace on the roof too. The only slight negative was the breakfast which was unimaginative and not to a great standard of quality. Overall would absolutely recommend we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel and in terrific location”
Reviews.Author: greyman47
Reviews.Content: We really liked the hotel. Its in a great location, away from the noisy part of Sultanahmet, but still close to all the attractions. The rooms are nicely furnished with large beds, a fridge and coffee/tea making facilites. The roof top garden commands what is close to the best possible view of the bosphorus and we enjoyed seeing dolphins frollicking there. The breakfast were very good although real fruit juices would have been a nice addition. Most of the rooms are excellent, but you may prefer to avoid the 2 basement rooms at the front, unless you are happy with windows which start above your eyeline. We weren't bothered by the rather gentle noise of the commuter trains. This hotel represents very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, so convenient”
Reviews.Author: shirleymartin38
Reviews.Content: Small very friendly helpful staff in Old part of the city. Such a great experience if you have not been to Istanbul before. Would go back tomorrow if I could! Visit Trade Fair Art Gallery & buy a carpet like I did - shipped back to Perth West Aust or buy a leather item eg leather jacket Erhan Adem Topaloglu or his Father will be only too pleased to be of assistance.

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful stay, we can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah062
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a different hotel over the internet, and upon arriving we were disappointed to discover that the rooms were significantly smaller than expected, so we decided to change hotel. We trekked around Sultanahmed area for quite some time and looked at many different hotels - all with small rooms (this is the old building style). Finally we came upon the hotel Ferman. The front-desk manager Erhan listened to our story with sympathy. He offered us a room with patio/balcony and swing, with a view towards the sea. When we view the room we discovered that the hotel had rooms far larger than those of all the hotels we had seen up until that point, which it turns out was because the hotel building itself was relatively recently built. We were so relieved to finally find this comfortable, chic, and welcoming hotel. The decor is very tasteful, and the views and spacious feel of the hotel extremely relaxing. We found the beds to be extremely comfortable, unlike a previous reviewer, and actually thought the railway behind the hotel added to the hotel's charm. We certainly didn't lose any sleep. The rooftop terrace where we enjoyed a delicious breakfast every day has stunning views of the sea and the mosque. Our only criticism would be that it got a bit chilly up there late at night. We were treated to a complimentary free meal, and free airport transfer (unlike the hotel we had booked online which wanted to charge us a high price!), and this was all for a very reasonable price. All of the staff were extremely attentive; if we ever needed something and it was lacking, all we had to do was ask and they arranged it for us promptly. Again we commend Erhan the front-desk manager for his professional manner, and advice to us on places to go, and general insight about the area and Turkish culture. In all, our whole stay in Istanbul was truly magical. We can't wait to go back, and we know where we will be staying when we do!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, helpful staff, stunning views from breakfast patio”
Reviews.Author: SpringFigaro
Reviews.Content: Was a bit leery when the bellboy escorted us into the lift and pressed 'B' for basement...he cheerily assured us that we would be happy with our room. Sure enough, room 101 featured a private patio! (don't be disturbed by the nearby private residence that looks over the patio, it is in need of some TLC, but hey, you can't control the actions of your neighbours) It was a lovely oasis, room enough for 4 to sit comfortably. We could hear the train from time to time, and also the calls to prayer. One doesn't come to central Istanbul for peace and tranquillity, so it was not an issue for us. The staff was always pleasant and helpful and spoke English quite well. Refreshments available in the lobby. The view from the breakfast patio is absolutely outstanding, both in the morning and at night. I would stay here again on a future trip to central Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: nickdillen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ferman Hotel for 4 nights at the beginning of June. We booked via a online travel agency. The room we had was located in the basement and very small. Not at all like the pictures on the website. The staff was a mixed bag. There were some staff members that were efficient and did an okay job, others were polite but rather unwelcoming. In general, we did not feel all that welcome at the hotel. Breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace which has amazing views of the Blue Mosque. Depending on the staff member in charge some food items and utensils would not be available. On the plus side, the hotel is ideally located for a first-time visitor to Istanbul. The hotel is located on the heart of Sultanahmet close to Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. I expected much more from this hotel. Allthough it has a good location, I would search for another hotel in the same area if I return to the city on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: PerthDiane
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the hotel. Never been to Istanbul before and used trip advisor to choose our hotel. Based on reviews we chose the Ferman and glad we did. Excellent service and the room was lovely - we stayed in the Sultan room. Location was great, short walk, 5 mins to Blue Mosque and Palace, 10 mins to Grand Bazaar. Close to shops and restaurants too. Thanks trip advisor and staff at the Ferman we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “*** hotel with ***** service and location.”
Reviews.Author: WWW3
Reviews.Content: The Ferman Hotel *** A very nice place to stay in Sultanahmet â€“ in walking distance to the big sites â€“ including the truly amazing cistern. In a busy neighborhood â€“ loaded with small hotels. Staff lovely, in a semi-professional way, speaking adequate English. A *** hotel with ***** service. Rooms acceptable â€“ neither of ours was anything like the photos â€“ but the outstanding feature is the rooftop terrace (breakfast early, drinks late). The harbor, and both Blue and Sophia mosques are right there. At night birds circle above the Blue Mosqueâ€™s six minarets â€“ Magic. In early and late May our double room rate was about $200/night, and like in lots of Turkey they give a 10% discount for cash. Donâ€™t miss going across the bridge to very lively Beyoglu, and especially to Mikla â€“ one of Europeâ€™s great restaurants ($250 for 2).

Reviews.Title: “We recommend in spite of some issues”
Reviews.Author: dialright
Reviews.Content: Pro: large, clean rooms with decent bathrooms. Terrific location. Nice staff. Con: basement breakfast location during low season Details: we had some issues with the rooms, but I'm convinced these were one-off problems such as a leaking bathroom pipe. The staff seemed more upset than we were, and surprised that we were not angry. They were responsive and helpful - resolving all the issues. Overall, we liked the hotel. During the stay they moved the breakfast from the basement, which was depressing, to the rooftop with a marvelous view of the Blue Mosque in one direction (see photo) and the water in the other direction. They need to brighten up that basement location. The food was adequate, nothing special. We noticed the train noise mentioned in some reviews, but it was not bothersome. Good idea to contact them in advance for airport pickup. It's in the rate if you deal with them direct.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MartzBoston
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Istanbul, we decided to stay in old town to be near the major sites. The Ferman Hotel is right there, a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque and 10 minutes to Hagia Sofia and Topkapki. The staff arranged for a free pickup at the airport (at 11:30 pm) and we were upgraded to a junior suite overlooking the Blue Mosque. The room was quiet, very spacious and very clean. Breakfast was included each day and was served on the roof deck overlooking the Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosque. The staff was very friendly and helpful and we genuinely enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we expected too much?”
Reviews.Author: KimPlusFriends
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul so we had no point of comparison. Arriving at the Ferman Hotel, we were pleasantly surprised as it looked more attractive than in the photos we'd seen. The Ferman is okay. Not brilliant, not bad. It is very well situated for Istanbul sightseeing, as are all the hotels in the Sultanahmet area. As first time visitors to Istanbul, Sultanahmet was the perfect location â€“ close to the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace, the hop on/off tour bus and within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar. We also loved hearing the muezzin from our rooms. There are also lots of excellent restaurants close by, especially Dubb (a few doors down from the hotel). It is perfect for a change in food variety and offers flawless service (it was so good we went there twice in four days). Our first impression of Turkeyâ€™s residents was the Fermanâ€™s reception staff. They were young, hadnâ€™t quite mastered English but pleasant enough. Compared to the helpful, friendly, obliging Turks we went on to meet, they seemed less engaging than most, though perfectly polite. The Ferman uses some kind of incense in the rooms/corridors. I was not well, and incense and â€˜flu is a horrible combination. The rooms are fine â€“ big, pretty comfortable and a bit old fashioned, but with some peculiarities (like no light or night table on one side of the bed in a double room). The bathrooms are acceptable. Our biggest gripe about the Ferman is the lack of a welcoming bar/lounge area. There was nowhere to sit and relax, or meet to plan our day. The lounge off the reception is bleak and unwelcoming, and the dining room in the basement is sterile (more suitable for a boarding school canteen than a hotel). Overall, our stay was adequate. Perhaps our expectations were too high, but the hotel was not ideal for our group.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, but noisy as hell”
Reviews.Author: HonestA
Reviews.Content: The three-way combination of the call to prayer, the train (located very close to the back of the hotel) and fog horns made this a bad sleep. The hotel's location, service, staff, and the room were great, but for relatively sensitive sleepers, I would suggest avoiding this place. I would also mention that the road is rather poor and for those with difficulties walking (not my wife or I), it would be a very poor choice indeed. Maybe some of the other rooms are not as noisy, but our's was.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location!”
Reviews.Author: gomunky
Reviews.Content: The Ferman Hotel was a wonderful place to stay during my recent trip to Istanbul. If you are looking to stay in the Sultanhmet area the location is great. The hotel is very close to all main attractions and the staff was very helpful. We stayed in room 404 and 405 and I highly recommend these rooms. Do ask to stay on the side away from the railroad tracks and not in the basement. Room 404 is the biggest since it is a corner room. The breakfast is a standard Turkish breakfast with fruits, cheese, eggs, olives, yogurt, etc. There is a wonderful roof top deck to view the Blue Mosque and the sea. The hotel staff was very helpful in providing information and arranging all our airport transports. Transport from the airport to the hotel was free.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo56
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Sultanahmet, at less than 10 minutes from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Perfect for tourists! very nicely furnished, spacious rooms; we had a room with a nice view on the Marmara sea. Only small drawback: noise from the trians running below (only during the day) and, being so close to several Mosques, the Muezzin's prayer call early in the morning (although I must say that I got used to it quickly and it never woke up our small child). The personnel were very nice and helpful. Special thanks to Ece Acar at the front desk and to Mahmut, the bellboy for making us feel really at home! I'd come back any time and recommend the hotel warmly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, polite & clean”
Reviews.Author: FuadHeydar
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to thank all the staff who really took care of me during the stay. Special thanks to Ece hanim, Erkan and Murat. Comfortoble bed, room size was real which you can see on their pics. On the other hand, I would like to mention that since I am at hospitality business since 7 years and working for one of the respectable chain hotels, I really recommend this hotel for those who really want to have amazing sightseeing tours at Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The best spot in all of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hawkk6785
Reviews.Content: After much debate about whether to stay in Sultanahmet or the modern side, my boyfriend and I decided to split our 7-night trip to Istanbul at hotels on each side. We started the week off at the Ferman, and we were beyond impressed! While we only booked a standard room through the internet, upon arrival we were upgraded to room 302 - which had a view of the Marmara Sea and a king size bed. What a good way to start off the trip! Everything about the hotel was fabulous, and after four nights at the Ferman, we actually canceled our reservations at the other hotel and stayed at the Ferman for the rest of our trip. As we had received a free airport transfer with a 4-night stay, we asked if it was possible to get the return transfer included as well - the staff were happy to meet this request. Rooms - Perfect mix of modern and old. The bed was very comfortable, bathrooms looked like they were brand new, and the Turkish decor was beautiful. Everything was exceptionally clean as well. Location - We're convinced that the Ferman was in the best spot possible. Located on a quiet side street, Ferman is just a short walk away from all the major sites and the rows of restaurants, shops and other hotels in the area. Staff - Outstanding! Extremely friendly and accommodating, and overall just great people to chat with! Value - One of the best values we've ever had. Amazing staff, beautiful rooms, great location, extremely clean, breakfast and airport transfers included.. all for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: sofienebenabdeslem
Reviews.Content: it's a an excellent hotel with fabulous sultan rooms...the bed was sooo comfortable...good heating...good sound-isolation...and after tiring days in istanbul (so much to see) it's really the good place to spend a good night...well furnished room and a nice welcoming ever-smiling staff specially Erkan who was really helpful...thanks willing to come back again...:)

Reviews.Title: “won't look to stay anywhere else on my next visit!”
Reviews.Author: tourist110
Reviews.Content: I've never left a review before on TA and have been to some of the best hotels around the world, but this time felt I truly needed to leave a review to let everyone know how amazing this hotel really was! their staff are all friendly, kind, unbelievably attentive and go all out to make your stay enjoyable! the location is superb- 5 mins away walking and your smack in the heart of sultanahmet square! the cleanliness is top notch! clean, comfortable and large rooms! and the free WI-FI is an added bonus! best of all is their customer services! on our last day there my mother injured her ankle, they were kind enough to provide us ice every 2 hours all through the night, allowed us to have a late check out for free and sent us breakfast to the room since she was in too much pain to move at no extra charge. they were kind and attentive and made us feel comfortable and at home! thank you so much Ferman Hotel! you were all superb and my mother is recovering well now :)))

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: One1Tiger
Reviews.Content: Very good indeed, Erkan and Murat were so helpful from the second we walked into the lovely looking Hotel. I cannot think of a single bit of Service that left me anything but happy and satisfied. If ever go back I wont have to search for a hotel again thatâ€™s for Sure. Ask Erkan & Murat anything at anytime and they will help with a smile and also really look out for you, with great suggestions for how to spend your time and where you can eat as it can be pricey close to the main attractions. Only downside is possibly the variety in breakfast, but that is me being really picky. Free Wi-FI made up for this n a big way.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay. Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: NeverOutGunned
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days. Great location in a quite alley within walking distance of the sights in Sultanahmet. Erkan and the rest of the team were very helpful and made our stay pleasant. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rhine-and-Roses
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ferman. The location was perfect for us. We loved the view from our room, although it was even better from the rooftop. Staff could not do enough to make our stay pleasant. We loved the tea provided in the lobby, and the wonderful suggestions for sightseeing and dining made by the staff. Our room was absolutely immaculate and we slept well. I worried about the train tracks outside our room, but we did not hear the train. We did hear the mosque, which you will hear no matter where you are in Sultanamet. I thought it added to the charm of the visit. If you do not like the sound of the calls to prayer, stay at the airport because you will hear it everywhere else. Breakfast was fine. I would have preferred it on the rooftop, but perhaps since it was still a little cool, it was served in the breakfast room. There was a decent choice. The breakfast was included in the cost of the room. Everything was clean and kept tidy. We got stuck in Istanbul during the volcano fiasco (Sorry, I just remembered to write this!) and called back to the hotel to ask for advice on what we might be able to do. As usual, they were friendly and really did try to help. They also offered us rooms at the same rate we had been paying, although we decided to stay out by the airport, in case a flight came open. If I returned to Istanbul, I would definitely stay here again, although I don't think I'd pay for the view again since we were in the room so little. Plus you cannot beat the view from the rooftop! You will feel sincerely welcome here. Istanbul is a great place, and the Ferman makes it just that much better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ferman is the essence of Turkish hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: LaNonnaSF
Reviews.Content: The highlight of our Ferman experience is the attentiveness of the staff in the reception, catering and the housekeeping areas. The sea-view room was spacious, sunny and spotless. The hotel location was an easy walk to the sights in the Sultanahmet area and had convenient public transportation links to other parts of Istanbul. The service, responsiveness and friendliness of the staff were the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great locatÄ±on, excelent servÄ±ce and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: DaneseCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days Ä±n Istanbul and were very well recieved by their personal at Ferman Hotel. Always frÄ±endly and helpfull personell at the receptÄ±on and Ä±n the restaurant, especÄ±ally Ecce, Erkan and Mahmut. Thank you for all your help and good servÄ±ce. The hotel Ä± located Ä±n the heart of the old part of Istanbul and has a great view to the sea and the mosques from the terrace. we wÄ±ll defÄ±nately come back to thÄ±s hotel agaÄ±n.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, location and service”
Reviews.Author: einai
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nigts at this lovely hotel. The location is perfect, in Sultanahmet near the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and other historical places, but in a quiet area. Very comfortable! The staff is young, friendly and very helpful; the rooms are modern, spacious, with a large balcony overlooking the sea, renewed and very clean. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ata Tabibzadeh”
Reviews.Author: AtaOTeh
Reviews.Content: My experience with Ferman was good from beginning to end. The receptionists were very helpful and friendly. The street the hotel is on is quiet yet is 5 minutes walk from the main tourist attraction in Istanbul. Cannot ask for more. The room was spacious and very clean. more

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: CampaspeLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the Fermen Hotel to be an excellent choice for Istanbul. It is close to the major tourist sites such as Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, etc. The immediate neighborhood is lively but not chaotic. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Internet works just fine. The staff is great and (rightfully) encouraged us to travel outside of the usual tourist spots. If it weren't for them, we would not have gone to the Asian side for dinner, and would have missed out on Ciya!!! Breakfast is adequate but not extravagant. You will not want to skip lunch. On my last day there I saw a couple eating omeletes, but I think they had to pay extra. Overall we find the Ferman has everything we look for in a hotel, at an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, location, rooms, service and price”
Reviews.Author: jamescdavidson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ferman Hotel for 5 days during our honeymoon and had a wonderful time. The staff is incredible, the location amazing and they had air conditioning!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation,and our stay at Ferman made it unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: AhOz
Reviews.Content: We stayed from the 29th december till the 5th of january,we booked the king room on the top floor,the view of the sea was amazing,the room was very nice and comfortable,very clean,the staff is just amazing,always ready to help ,the location couldnt be better,close to all the major sites in a very nice hood where u will find anything ,all kinds of restaurants ,pubs ,gift shops,carpet shops,jewelry,a long story made short,istanbul is a beautyfull city,and our stay at Ferman made our vacation unforgettable,we will be back for sure. Regards to all the staff Ekar,Ece,Mahmoud,Adnan....everybody,thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, location, rooms, service and price”
Reviews.Author: shoh
Reviews.Content: Summed up in the title. The staff are great and make you feel very welcome from the word go. The location could not be better just a stones throw away from the main attractions (initially it can be a little difficult to find, but after that it's easy). The recommendations are spot on...listen to the guys at the desk...they're not conning you or making money out of you. The only downside is the breakfast which could be improved a little. Thank you to all who made our stay over xmas so perfect at the Ferman Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bgrwd
Reviews.Content: Small family run hotel - perfect as a base to see old Istanbul and in an area brimming with small hotels and restaurants. Rooms are on the small side but no complaints, our top floor room with balcony gave fabulous views over the bosphorus. Hotel, has a great roof terrace with superb views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia etc, a very relaxed breakfast and friendly staff for whom nothing is too much trouble. The hotel does back onto a railway line and I can see why some might be disturbed by it but the trains where infrequent and we were not bothered by them - my guess is that any hotel in this area will be effected to some degree. I would not recommend for business but as a long weekend getaway for adults I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Staff”
Reviews.Author: cspsachs1
Reviews.Content: I could not have been more pleased with our decision. The staff including Erkan Tosun and Murat made our stay special; not only was the boutique hotel lovely but the staff gave us personal and excellent recommendations with food, outings and lounges. They went above and beyond-completely set themselves apart from the other hotels in the Sultanahmet

Reviews.Title: “A nice small hotel in the best part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AnnieHiggins
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet is the old Istanbul, full of narrow cobbled streets with small hotels and a wide variety of small restaurants. The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are a few minutes walk away, as is the tram stop. The Ferman Hotel (a ferman is a written declaration by the ruler, on a scroll, in elaborate calligraphy; they have examples as wall decoration) is modern and nicely decorated. We had a king suite as we were staying for a week and wanted plenty of space. The room was spacious, with a large balcony overlooking the Sea of Marmara (as well as the train tracks). The trains are noisy, but don't run between midnight and 6am, so it's not really an issue. By 6am the morning call to prayer will have wakened you anyway! The King Suites are on the 3rd floor, directly beneath the breakfast terrace. The noise of people going up the stairs to breakfast wasn't an issue, but the scraping of chairs just above the ceiling was noisy, but then breakfast doesn't start until 7am, so that wasn't a problem. The breakfast terrace is a great plus point (all the adjacent hotels also have them) as the view is spectacular. In the middle of our stay, the weather deteriorated and breakfast was moved to a soulless basement room with no windows, which is it's winter quarters, and much inferior. Breakfast itself was the usual buffet spread and quite acceptable, but the choice of cold meats is limited due to lack of pork products. Coffee lovers beware, the coffee comes out a vending-type machine and is not very nice. Other than Turkish coffee (which isn't drunk at breakfast time) the only coffee that seemed available even when we went to a large hotel was this vending machine type. Some of the hotel rooms open directly off the lobby, and some are in the basement; they clearly would not have a view, and may be noisy although there is not much street noise in this area. The front desk staff were not as knowledgeable as those in other European hotels e.g. they could not give us a map, or recommend a restaurant, or help with directions for public transport. All of them were, however, very pleasant. Our guide book was invaluable for these functions (DK Eyewitness Travel Top 10 Istanbul). Istanbul is a victim of it's own popularity; the place is seething with tourists both from the hotels but also pouring off the cruise ships. We were told it is only quiet in December. The crush of people at all the major attractions certainly detracts from the enjoyment of the visit: we are talking Sistine Chapel type queues and throngs of people. Restaurants tend to be as expensive as England, and we had some lovely meals in really characterful restaurants such as "Rami" where you dine looking at the Blue Mosque, "Sarnic" which is in an old cistern, or "The Orient Express" which is the restaurant in the station where the original Orient Express used to arrive and depart.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: pige_paa_ferie
Reviews.Content: My experience with Ferman was good from beginning to end. The receptionists were very helpful and friendly. Breakfasts were taken with views of the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque. The street the hotel is on is quiet yet is 5 minutes walk from the main tourist attraction in Istanbul. Cannot ask for more. The room was spacious and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Brilliant Service”
Reviews.Author: wicko24
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this lovely hotel. The rooms were brilliant and staff very helpful. Located in the heart of Old Istanbul was very easy to get around to all the major attractions and central to many great restaurants. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice.”
Reviews.Author: Arasta2010
Reviews.Content: The Ferman Hotel was a revelation. The location, the staff, the breakfast, the rooms with extraordinary views of the Bosphorous on one side and the Bleu Mosque and the Aya Sofia/church/ Mosque on the other side. The comfortable beds. The location within very short walking distance of the Arasta Bazaar, great restaurants, the Cistern ,the Archeological Museum, the Mosaic Museum, the Bleu Mosque, The AyaSofia Church/Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. I must mention the lovely young lady at the desk during the day who was so helpful in many ways, and Erkan Ece and Murat Bicici at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ev94114
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in October. Perfectly located near Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Very nice room with friendly service. Our room was on the first floor which are the bigger rooms. Noise was a bit of an issue. The commuter train runs right behind the hotel. It stops running at 11pm and starts up at around 5am. We were already up at that hour as the Cantor at the Blue Mosque can be heard everywhere at 5am. Frankly the Cantor's song was beautiful so we didn't mind it at all. If it's your first visit I would recommend it as it near all the main attractions in Istanbul. Not that close to the center of town but public transit is nearby and very easy to figure out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if you avoid the basement rooms”
Reviews.Author: WiseWoman70
Reviews.Content: The hotel has some great assets: a great location close to the main old city attractions, pleasant staff, nicely appointed rooms and baths, and good free internet access. Unfortunately, there were a couple of negatives that potential guests should protect themselves from. If you do not want a room in the basement (below ground level), be sure you specify that in your reservation. This hotel and some others in the old city of Istanbul have rooms below ground level, and if you don't say you want to be above ground, you may find yourself with no window to look out of. We hated it. Also they said they turned off the air conditioning on a certain day and turned on the heat. It was hot and humid below ground, and we were quite uncomfortable with only a fan which they brought in for us. Those two problems spoiled our positive feelings about the hotel which was probably fine for those above ground. Also the breakfast left something to be desired for westerners, namely real coffee and real juice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, be selective of your room location though.”
Reviews.Author: Bayla1222
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on other TripAdvisor reviews. The location is absolutely where you want to be if you choose to stay in the Old Town (which I highly recommend). The hotel service is very good. When you book, do not allow them to put you in rooms 201 and 202 - they are literally right off the lobby front desk so all the noise of folks stpping to ask directions or chat with the front desk flows right into your room. The rooms are nice, very clean and modern. The views from the rooftop are gorgeous. The breakfast is very poor - some fruit was the best part. The milk was out most of the time, the coffee was Nescafe which is just bad, the cereal was stale and the list goes on. No major complaints and I'd probably stay here again, but I'd ask for floors 3 or above and I'd opt to eat out for b-fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: WfcInperth
Reviews.Content: I fully endorse the positive comments made on this site the only negatives for us were a poor wifi connection slow and dropped out frequently and an uninspiring breakfast selection. However the positives of this hotel far out way these negatives. We have no hesitation in recomending it.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not special”
Reviews.Author: JC2
Reviews.Content: I looked at four hotels in Instanbul based on Trip Advisor ratings and chose the Ferman based on price and availability. The Ferman is a fine choice. Among the good things about the hotel: it's location, the beautiful views from the rooftop terrace, the large size of the room and bathroom, it's very clean, the staff is helpful.
