Among the not so great things: the breakfast is mediocre at best - no real coffee just Nescafe out of a machine, there was no hot water one evening, the toilet leaked water on the floor, ground floor rooms 201 and 202 can be very noisy. If I visit Istanbul again, I would consider staying at the Ferman but would also check out the Acra, which is just down the street and is also highly rated on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, close to historic attractions”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBiggels
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through the internet and it was a fairly painless process, good communication via email and very responsive. Had requested pick up at the airport, but could not find the driver at the airport, so jumped into a taxi. Suggest that you simply get a taxi as it is cheaper as well. The check in process was very friendly and efficeint. We had the King Room Suit and it was has advertised. Had a balcony with lovely views towards the Mamara sea and Asian part. The bed was fantastic and the bathroom clean and spacious. The room was spacious, however don't expect a football field :) The breakfast was on the top terrace overlooking the sea and historic parts with a fantastic view of the Blue Musque. If there is one thing they can improve is the breakfast, as it was on the basic side. We would certainly stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: mdrrar
Reviews.Content: The Ferman Hotel was a great choice for us. I was traveling with my 20 something daughter. The Hotel is ideally located half way between the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the Hippodrome site are all within 5 or 6 blocks. They tram system is equally close and the Grand Bazaar is not much farther. There is ample shopping and restaurants in the area. We thought it was an ideal location for exploring historic Istanbul. The hotel is located on a quiet street, although there is a commuter train track on the sea side. We did not think that it was a deterrant to being on that side of the hotel, but if you are a light sleeper, you may want to consider that. The staff was very nice and helpful. There English ranged from adequate to good. The hotel has free Wi Fi that worked well. The Ferman has a rooftop terrace that may have the best view in the area. We thought it was spectacular. Unfortunately, they were having some improvements done so it was only open for breakfasts, during our stay. Breakfasts were standard for Turkey. A wide range of breads, cheeses, jams and some warm meats. Eggs were hard boiled. We had an Ocean Room, #402 I think. It was of comfortable size and had a great view. The bathroom had a shower/tub combination and was nicely appointed and not too small. If there was any drawback to the bathroom it may have been the quality of the towels, but that seems like nitpicking. We thought the Ferman was a great experience and I would definately stay there again if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: fk87
Reviews.Content: i stayed in Ferman hotel for a week. room 303 was amazing: big and had a beautiful view overlooking to the sea. the staff and personnels were very friendly and helpful. i'd go to this hotel if i visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “One of my most enjoyable stays”
Reviews.Author: TravelReview_by_Anne
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the lovely Sultan's room on the first floor with a small balcony and a front-facing street view. The dependable and free WI-FI room was a nice size with enough room for a table laden with welcoming local fruits, a large stuffed chair, a king-sized bed and a mini-bar. I found a local food store close by and the location to the sites was perfect. The charming Ottoman-styled lobby had free lokum (Turkish Delight) and biscuits to nibble. The staff was extremely helpful and just downright good people. With the 10% cash discount my room cost was decent considering the costs of rooms in perfect weather high-season September in Istanbul and I asked for a higher priced room. I overheard one man commenting that he paid half the price of the Hilton and got a lovely ocean view room. I heard only one muffled nightly call to prayer in my quiet room as I slept soundly my entire five day stay. It was almost a perfect number of days to spend in Istanbul, although I wanted one more day to see the Chora Church, Ortakoy and the Dolmabahce Palace. I walked almost everywhere the detailed Rick Steve's Istanbul guidebook led me. The Lonely Planet guide had smaller print and was not as complete as Rick Steve's. The combination of the book and the metro made a more expensive guide completely unnecessary. The only attraction I wasn't amazed by was the whirring devish as I found the production rather boring, but a Turkish bath is not to be missed! As a woman travelling alone, I found Istanbul an extremely safe, warm and friendly place to travel unaccompanied. Every time I got turned around, someone assisted me and they didn't want to sell me a carpet! I was most bothered by the carpet salesman and guides around some of the famous attractions, but only in a slightly annoyed way. When I learned they received a nice commission for their salesmanship in todayâ€™s troubling economic times, I understood why they were persistent. As an older traveler, I was most impressed with a lively conversation I experienced with a small group of young businessmen who kindly paid for my lunch as I was dining in one of Istanbulâ€™s famous eateries. The food in Istanbul was SO much tastier and healthier than the State's and I became addicted to ayran, the local yogurt drink and fresh squeezed fruit juices, particularly pomegranate. I ate everywhere, even at the self-serve local Turkish eateries. Don't listen to the guidebooks when they try to tell you the old Sultanahmet area is not THE best place to hang your Turkish fez as I couldn't have asked for a better fun-filled vacation and a classier place to stay than the finely appointed, centrally located and brand-new Ferman.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Excellent staff in a perfect Location. You must stay here”
Reviews.Author: Robandjean
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Ferman. It was really, really brilliant. The English speaking staff were so friendly and helpful it felt like home. Ece ACAR and Erkan on the desk gave me so much help whilst booking that I felt I knew them before we arrived, and during our stay they were really friendly, helpful and very efficient. (I booked an extra room for our friends to join us) We had a 'Sultan's Room' (404) with a little balcony on the street side looking towards the Blue Mosque.The action in the street was so great to watch, children playing and locals walking by, that the Mosque view became unimportant. (It is just up the road, you will walk past it every day!) The room is a good size and very clean and comfortable with an area to sit with a little table. The rooms with no balcony are a bit smaller, but still very nice. I had read worries about train noise on the side with the sea view so I chose the Mosque side. However the sea view was great and the A/C was very good indeed so you could keep the windows shut at night.(We did anyway). You will get woken early with a call to prayer from the Mosques wherever you are. All part of the fun. We loved breakfast on the roof. There was plenty to choose from and Mahmut and Adran were always fun and helpful. Do not expect a fry up. (Stay home for that.) I had read the view was good,. but wow, not THAT good. It really takes your breath away. Try it again at night with a coffee. The Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya are all lit up, and the sea view is just amazing. There is no evening eating at the hotel, but there are great choices of places to eat close by so this is no problem at all. (Top trip adviser restaurants are just up the road in Akbiyik cad , and not expensive. (Try Albura Kathisma, it has a cave!.) The location is just about perfect. The Hotel is in an interesting quiet little street and a 5 mins walk gets you to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and the other main attractions in Sultanahmet. You can walk the other way to get to the sea for a nice walk to the fish markets, or explore the little back streets which are really interesting. Trams , buses and taxis are cheap and close by as well. I would certainly go back to this lovely Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: cmv91
Reviews.Content: The ideal location for visiting the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya, with many shops and restaurants in a pleasant neighborhood. Friendly, helpful English speaking staff, delicious breakfast served on the roof terrace with a view of the Blue Mosque which is just a few blocks away. Reasonable rates, comfortable rooms. I couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great potential, but rude and incompetent manager!”
Reviews.Author: RichardRiyadh
Reviews.Content: I planned to spend 9 nights here, but ended up pulling out after only 3, as the property is NOT as depicted on its website. There is no restaurant in the hotel, the teleivsion has only Turkish channels (along with one or two in Italian), and the WiFi is miserable, and browsing is impossible. The Sultan room supposedly has a view of Sultan Ahmet Mosque, but the reality is, what you see is the tips of 2 minarets. Nothing more. Breakfast is so meager as to be pathetic,even for Turkish hotels. When I presented my disappointment to one of the staff,the extraordinarily gauche and rude manager insisted on giving me a lecture in the lobby and went so far as to call me a liar! It is obvious that the man has no idea about customer service, and certainly no idea about how to run a hotel. The owners of the hotel should - in my opinion - replace him with someone who knows something about hotel management. If you want to spend 2-3 nights near Sultan Ahmet, this hotel may work for you. But beware: the manager is vicious, rude and insulting. And take everything you read on the hotel's website with a very large grain of salt.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location in a modern boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosared1
Reviews.Content: We spent three pleasant nights in the hotel. It has a small lobby but beautiful large modern rooms with marble showers and modern facilities. From our wall-to-wall window we had a magnificent uninterrupted view of the Bosphorus, the Sea of Marmara, and the Princes Islands in the distance (4th floor room). Rooms on the other side face the famous Blue Mosque and Haja Sophia. Breakfast was served buffet style on the rooftop terrace with a fabulous 360 view of the region. Good assortment of fruit, cheeses, jams, eggs and meat, etc. The staff was very professional and helpful in getting us a guide and answering questions. The hotel is spotless. It is a five minute walk from the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, etc. Best to take a taxi from the airport only 20 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lars029
Reviews.Content: A nicely designed hotel in Ottoman style, but in quite modern and attractive way. Hotel does look good, but at the time of my staying there, there were some problems. I didnt sleep well because of syntetic quilt and lots of nice as they were still building the terrace: The webpage said that the hotel had a terrace with a nice view over the city, but it wasn't finished at all. i guess now it's already open for public. the breakfast was rather boring then not. I got the smaller room then was advertised on webpage, the reason was that i took a twin bed room, which is smaller then king size bed room, but the price was the same. I mentioned that at the reception, but was told that nothing cant be done. Anyway, the hotel was clean, on good location and honestly it's hard to find a decent hotel in Istanbul :)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it - now our base in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: anngray76
Reviews.Content: A most comfortable hotel. Extremely high standards in all respects, yet with a family feel. The view from the roof bar/breakfast area is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel with great service, staff, location!”
Reviews.Author: ewl224
Reviews.Content: Ferman Hotel is located in Sultanahmet, the old city of Istanbul. It is within 10 minutes walking distance to the Blue Mosque and Ayasofya. The rooftop has a GREAT view. The rooms are new and comfortable. The breakfast isn't bad, but could be better. There is an elevator in this hotel, which isn't always the case in other hotels in Turkey. All of the staff members were very helpful, but Erhan deserves a special mention. I had a number of special / last-minute requests and he was able to accommodate them. He even went the extra mile to ensure our stay was a pleasant one. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff, great service”
Reviews.Author: dmcillini
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights to start off our honeymoon and had a great experience at this hotel. We stayed in a 'Sultan's Room' and it was decent sized (for European standards). It was clean, nicely decorated, had a nice bathroom, and even a little balcony. The hotel is in a prime location, as pretty much all of Sultanahmet was walkable. They have the most amazing views from the rooftop terrace. We really enjoyed the breakfast was served on the rooftop every morning. However, probably the best part of this hotel is the staff (especially Erehon and Ece?). They were extremely friendly and helpful and had some great recommendations. When researching this hotel on tripadvisor, I saw several reviews that complained about the noise from the train tracks. I asked for a room on the front side of the hotel when I booked a room, and noise was never an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Close to 5 star hotel with 5 star view”
Reviews.Author: oblugnut
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 504 which had a view of the Blue Mosque filling the window. Yes, this meant the call to prayer was rather loud, but the blending of the call with the calls from the surrounding Mosques was etherial. We wake early anyway, and there is so much to see and do we needed an early start. We chose the street side rather than the Bosphorus view with the islands of the Marmara Sea, tankers and freighters waiting for passage overlooking the tracks. They did ask us to change to the Bosphorus view side, but we politely declined after viewing the room, although it was very nice and evidently costs more. Breakfast was dull, but we found a place 1 1/2 blocks away where the cook made me eggs to order after a bit of pictionary and mangled Turkish. Would stay again. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “It was divine intervention that I found this gem!”
Reviews.Author: Solamores
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel at the last minute (literally 3 hours before arriving in Istanbul) and it turned out to be magnificent. Like others have said, the location was excellent, very near to major sites, tramway and tons of restaurant choices. It was easy to get a taxi near as well to take me into the new city area on the other side of the Bosphorous. As a solo female American traveler I felt very safe at this hotel and in the area. The rooms were modern, clean and well decorated. Of course the best part of the hotel was the quality staff and the incredible personal service they provided. On my first morning at the hotel, I woke up late and even though the breakfast time had been over for nearly an hour, they still offered and I was able to enjoy food with the incredible rooftop terrace views. Every morning, the staff ensured that I had dined no matter what time it was. The hotel reception staff were all very knowledgeable; of special note was Erhan who went out of his way to explain things; show me sights on the map and make restaurant and evening suggestions that turned out to be excellent. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others. I am now in love with Istanbul and one of the reasons was because of my experiences at the Ferman.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Can walk to all historical sites”
Reviews.Author: wrdtrvler48
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within walking distance to restaurants and historical sites. Breakfast was served on a beautiful terrace overlooking the entrance to the Bosporous. Watching the boats enter the straits each morning and leave in the evening was exteremely relaxing. They arranged a wonderful tour guide and suggested many wonderful restaurants ..

Reviews.Title: “excellent located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natandneill
Reviews.Content: great location for exploring sulthanamet area, we went with friends who dont walk anywhere so we found that the location of ferman hotel was excellent! the view from the roof terrace where we went for late night drinks and breakfast was fantastic, especially at night with the blue mosque lit up!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, wonderful views from terrace”
Reviews.Author: PJWellingtonNZ
Reviews.Content: Our stay here did not get off to a good start as I was not picked up by a driver they arranged. This, however, was not their fault. To make amends for this, they arranged free return transport to the airport. Very impressive! Note: I was told that If you are booking this hotel, they will provide free return transport to Ataturk airport if you tbook through their website -or by phone. Not if you book through an agency. this is worth 35 euro so it is worth asking about. Our room was an average size - I was slightly disappointed it was downstairs and did not have windows that I could look out of. We were at basement level as we had booked one of their cheaper rooms. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The room was a bit dark - could not put make up on in the bathroom as it was very dark in there. Only one side of the bed had a side light which we felt was unusual and lacking. The wireless internet was excellent. So was the breakfast on the Terrace. It was an average continental breakfast - cereal, bread, cold meats etc. but the views were stunning and the terrace was set out very nicely. A lounger would have bene nice though. My husband really got on well with the night manager - he went out of his way to help, was great company in the middle of a sleepless night, and organised a great boat trip as well. It was a great location - five minutes to walk to all of the main attractions and just around the corner - a street lined with restaurants. Very touristy but very safe. All in all, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ferman Hotel is friendly, clean with a great location and beautiful views from rooftop terrace.”
Reviews.Author: nbnNatick
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed being at the Ferman Hotel. It was clean and had friendly service. The location is excellent and the value good. We especially loved their roof terrace with beautiful views over the Sea of Marmara. A good breakfast came with the room and was served on the terrace. Ask for a room overlooking the street and maybe on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: speedrail
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Istanbul for 10 days with my girlfriend, and the Ferman was the absolute perfect base for our stay. Upon arrival, was informed that they had upgraded us to the penthouse. Amazing views of the Blue Mosque and the Marmara. Staff was beyond helpful. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: TnJChichester
Reviews.Content: The staff, location and views make this hotel a gem. Such a friendly welcome from everyone with nothing too much trouble. Penthouse rooms are well worth the extra cost. Views from the room and the rooftop terrace are amazing. Small negative - noise of furniture being moved around on the terrace in the early hours but this was going to be fixed soon. Ms Eca (pronounced Etcha) is an excellent manager. Speak to her about rates. Great eating places (the wine is sooo expensive) around the hotel, most with rooftop dining areas with fantastic views of the mosques. A great stay so thanks to everyone at the Ferman.

Reviews.Title: “great position”
Reviews.Author: csnlondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable and the staff were helpful, we had some rooms on the lower floor at the rear , which have large terraces, and are next to the railway line, however we did not find this to be a problem as the trains did not run at night, indeed the view is interesting. The roof terrace has great views of the blue mosque and the aya sofia,as well as the bosphorus, and is really nice place to have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fishbournefolk
Reviews.Content: Rooftop terrace for breakfast or evening coffee/nightcap is stunning, with great views of sea one side and Blue Mosque/Aya Sofya the other. We had a 3rd floor room with balcony facing the Blue Mosque and also direct view of this from the bed...had to pinch myself! Absolutely made the weekend. Rooms to rear overlook railway, though doesn't seem too busy? Modern fittings, lift, aircon all good and ideally situated. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, big room”
Reviews.Author: SilvanoB71
Reviews.Content: Great position, in the heart of old city and big room.Only one matter...they forgot our breakfast the day of our leaving...but it's a small problem. Silvano e Alessandra Italy

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in touristy location very near the major sights”
Reviews.Author: TaisonLondon
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 4 day stay at the Ferman. The hotel is in a great location for seeing all the major sights in Sultanahmet within a few minutes walk of everything. The area is very touristy though so we preferred to travel a bit further for dinner etc to hang out where the locals do. As stated before the view from the rooftop terrace is excellent though pretty much all hotels in this area have terraces of some description. The buffet breakfast was good. I also gather the hotel is in the process of trying to obtain permission to cover the terrace with glass so that breakfast can be eaten there year round. The train noise didn't bother us as we're used to noise living in London but could be a problem if you're a light sleeper. That said no trains seem to run at night. Overall an excellent value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for third honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: momofour61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Istanbul for 7 nights for our 20th anniversary. On our budget, all I really wanted was a great location and a clean room at a good price. This hotel exceeded our expectations. The rooms are beautifully decorated and ours was spotless and cleaned well every day. We couldn't have been happier with the location. Not only is it walking distance to some of the major sights, the neighborhood itself is very charming, and the hotel is on one of its quietest streets. With that said, we had an ocean view room and there is a commuter train that goes by about every half hour very close to the hotel. I think it stops at night because it didn't keep me up. If it had been cooler and we had had the window open (we had a/c on), it would have been pretty loud. But it's just the noise of a train on tracks - you hear it coming, passing quickly, and then going away; it's not a sudden or jarring noise. Ear plugs probably would have totally erased it. And like I said, it never woke me up. What did sometimes semi-wake me was the call to prayer, but you're not going to avoid that in Istanbul. The staff said that streetside rooms with views of the Blue Mosque are somewhat quieter. I would have been happy to have a view of the Blue Mosque - it wasn't like we were sitting in the room much looking at the Sea. There was plenty of time on the water outside of the hotel. And the Mosque is beautiful. It might be noisier on the 5th floor - we were on the 4th - because that's where people get off the elevator in the morning to walk up to the roof for breakfast. I wish people would keep the volume down when they know others could be sleeping. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They were very patient in waiting for us to get enough cash out of the ATM to pay for our room. They answered all our questions, helped us plan sightseeing, and made reservations at a couple of restaurants for us. Besides being near the major sights, the hotel is also a quick walk to the tram station. If you buy a token near the entrance for 1.5 Turkish lira, you can hop on the street car and get to most of the other sights you'll want to see. We rode it a lot. And if you're really up for it, you can even walk to most of the big sights with a pair of good shoes. The view from the roof terrace is extraordinary. We didn't end up drinking on the roof in the afternoon like we had thought we would. The front desk said they'd send someone up (it looked like they had soft drinks and beer in cans), but we told them never mind and we went to one of the many other rooftop bars and restaurants in the area. We found a place that we think may have the very best view in Istanbul, or at least in that part of the city. The Seven Hills Restaurant has a roof terrace with the best views of the Sea of Marmara, the Blue Mosque, and the Aya Sofia. It's the highest terrace in the area, so there's nothing blocking the 360 view. Try going there when the sun is setting so you can see it in daylight and also at night. Amazing! The food isn't bad either. And Turkish wine is surprisingly good. We drank wines from all over the country. We very highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ea701
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I recently (May 22, 2010) stayed at Ferman. Overall, we would highly recommend Ferman. The location was ideal (a ten minute walk from the main Istanbul sites like the Blue Mosque). (Although this does mean that you hear the call to prayer at dawn.) The rooms were spotless, and well-decorated. We had an ocean view double (155 dollars) and a standard double (135 dollars). The ocean view room was spectacular, with a big balcony. However, the standard was extremely small, with no balcony--two people would be a tight squeeze. The service was wonderful. The front desk staff, Erhan, Erkan, and Ece, were incredibly warm, helpful, and accomodating, providing advice and helping with arrangements. The breakfast, served on a rooftop terrace with amazing views of the water, the blue mosque and aya sofia, was a highlight, with the best halva we had in Turkey (breakfast halva of chocolate, date and walnut--if it's not out, ask for it).

Reviews.Title: “Location, comfort, and beauty!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayHedgehog
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the 3rd floor facing The Blue Mosque. The view outside of my window was great! The street is very close to all of the sites, yet quiet. The rooms were nicely appointed, the bed very comfortable, and the bathroom roomy and nice. Breakfast was in the basement while renovations were being prepared on the roof top dining area. The view from the roof top takes in the Aya Sofia, as well as the Blue Mosque, and ships passing on the Marmara Sea. It was a very pleasant stay with a supportive hotel staff. I will definitely stay again, and I look forward to having breakfast on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: VivianBogota
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my sister fro three nights and we felt at home from the moment we stepped into the hotel. The staff did everything and more to make us feel good. The area of the hotel is beautiful, it is full of nice small restaurants and shops and walking distance from most tourist attractions and the tram that can take you everywhere else. Our room was very nice and the roof top terrace where breakfast is served has a breathtaking view. Breakfast was O.K., it was the only thing that I believe could use some improvement. But overall, the hotel is the perfect boutique hotel to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Service and the Hotel are unbelievable...the best!”
Reviews.Author: innerpathphoto
Reviews.Content: I would go back and stay at this hotel in a heartbeat. The rooms are beautiful, the service is excellent, the breakfast was delicious, and the rates were very reasonable, especially considering the prime location and quality of everything. The staff could not do enough for me...when I expressed an interest in moving to a higher floor, they went out of their way to find me a choice of rooms that had beautiful water views, or a view of the Blue Mosque, lots of light...I was in heaven. The service was very personal, when we asked for restaurant recommendations, staff was very good at listening to what we liked, what we wanted to explore, and gave us a range of suggestions. They also gave us some good tips for getting around the city, and dos and don'ts for safety. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the major historical and religious attractions, restaurants, and parks. After a long day, we enjoyed being able to return to the hotel, refresh, and only have to walk 10 minutes to a large choice of restaurants, and then have a short and pleasant walk back. There is a wonderful rooftop patio with tables, chairs...breakfast served in the summer? (Too cold when we were there.) The views are stunning, and if you want a quiet break but still want to enjoy the vibe of the city, it's a great place to be. We were very sad to leave for another hotel partway through our trip...they were already fully booked for Easter weekend or we would have stayed...and when we went to our new hotel, the contrast in quality, value, and service really made us homesick for the Ferman and our new hotel friends. Only tip I would offer: There are rooms on the ground floor that are very high quality, but little window light. If you want sunlight and views, ask for a room on the 3rd floor and above. Stay there! and enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “Best and most personal Service in a Hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Pascal350
Reviews.Content: We drove from Switzerland to Istanbul by car. Of course it was a very long trip and when we arrived in Istanbul we were tired and just wanted to feel comfortable. We found the Ferman Hotel and we were so surprised to find such a personal and friendly service so late at night. They truly made every effort to make us feel at home. Everybody was so nice and not in a fake way. It was just great! A true treasure! PS: Best breakfast on top of Istanbul! Thanks again to the staff of the Ferman Hotel! Pascal and Barbara

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraEver
Reviews.Content: The people make this hotel among the best. As a solo traveler I love a hotel that makes me feel at home, I had the most comfortable stay at the Ferman. The staff are extremely helpful, polite, professional and friendly. The hotel is in a great location, though a very touristy area, the rooms are good size, very clean and comfortable, the rooftop has gorgeous views of the Bosphorus and Blue Mosque. The breakfast good, the staff is always quick to bring you tea and ask if they can help any time you're in the lobby. They had electrical converters on hand and went above and beyond helping me with my laptop. I had accidentally booked an extra night at the hotel through Expedia, paid in advance, the Ferman quickly credited the night back to Expedia who immediately credited my card which I was very happy about. All in all an amazing experience, I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay at the ferman”
Reviews.Author: kathrynDundee
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Ferman hotel which i would highly recommend. Location perfect 10/15 minutes walk from Topkapi Palace, Agia Sophia, Blue Mosque. The hotel is spotless, breakfasts very tasty, special mention to Ece, Erhen on reception and Adnan who serves the breakfasts. Had a wonderful time here and would tell anyone to go, rooms are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and great service in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Geoff_from_Oz
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is now top of our list of must-see cities! We stayed at the Ferman from 23rd to 30th April 2010 in one of the King Suites on the top level with a magnificent view of the Bosphorus meeting the Sea of Marmara. The room was plenty big enough for the week with a large semi-private balcony, which afforded us a neck-craning view of the Blue Mosque as well. The accompanying photos were all taken in our room or from our balcony. Handy to the major tourist sites on foot, the trams made it easy to reach those outside Sultanahmet or simply return closer to the hotel with tired children. Take care - many of the streets are cobbled and without stroller/pushchair-friendly footpaths. However, if you plan to take cars or taxis for shorter trips, the traffic and narrow streets may defeat you. Our 2 and 5 year-old stayed free of charge, sharing the sofa bed and they loved to watch the metro as it whizzed by. The double-glazing meant that the noise was never obtrusive and we slept undisturbed. We did hear the morning call to prayer and although we are used to this, it did droan on a while. But if you want to be in the middle of the tourist beat, don't complain about the atmosphere! The duty manager was most often Ms Ece Acar who had helped immensely with pre-arrival queries, airport pick-up and tour bookings. All of the staff seemed genuinely friendly and every request was met promptly and with a smile. Only one hiccup in the tour bookings (due to an understandable language difficulty) but this was more than made up for by our 1/2-day cruise of the Bosphorus â€“ a charming boat with a family-like crew offering personal and complete service. The brochures are at reception, so just ask Ece to book one for you upon arrival. Despite being advertised, the top-floor restaurant was still in construction and room service was unavailable, even from their nearby sister hotels. Of course, we ate out every day and most nights, so it was less of a burden than we had imagined, even with small children in tow. A breakfast buffet was available every morning in the basement dining room. The basics were all there â€“ in-room Wi-Fi; air conditioning; in-room safe; hot water with good pressure any time of day; shower/bath; mini-bar with alcoholic beverages included, elevator/lift was small but modern and worked; flat screen TV with 40+ channels but very little for children, even less in English. Some of the rooms (perhaps 3) do open on to the foyer/lobby but their doors are screened and the foyer seldom occupied except by the duty staff member. Our son loved the self-service, complimentary Turkish delight available in the foyer best of all.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying Stay in a Super Spot in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: feeni
Reviews.Content: This is a rather late posting but I'm sure it will provide useful to others who are considering this charming little hotel in the magical city of Istanbul. Arrival: At the time of our stay, there was an offer of a free pick-up from the airport plus a few extras if the stay was for 7 nights. I emailed the hotel ahead of our stay informing them of our arrival time and when we arrived at the airport, we found that nobody was there to collect us. After searching through the throngs of people with placards checking for our names, we eventually heard our names announced over a tannoy system as due to a short delay on our flight, the driver got a little fed up with waiting at the gate for us! Nice! After a 25-30 minute drive, we arrived at the Ferman. Initially, we were allocated a ground floor room which was huge but not ideal because the hotel is built infront of a railtrack so every time a train went past, the noise was loud enough to make me jump. In addition, you could hear everything that was going on in the reception/lobby area just outside the room. I spoke to the young man on reception at the time (Sinan Erdogan) and he said he would speak to the manager about arranging a room change. I was quite surprised when I was told later that the manager said we could change rooms but we would be charged extra for this. Not a good start to our holiday. The following day, I was informed by Sinan that a room had just been vacated on the first floor and we could move free of charge. He kindly allowed us to inspect a similar room first and we were moved later once the vacated room had been cleaned. Fantastic! However, once the room was ready for us to move into, the porter who was going to move our luggage up for us decided to walk into our room without knocking and I had just come out of the shower! I screamed and ducked behind a sofa. A genuine mistake though; the porter was extremely embarrassed and very apologetic. No major harm done and something my husband still chuckles about to this day as apparently I screamed like a little girl and he'd never seen me move so fast! A small fruit platter was delivered to us by way of apology, which wasn't necessary as it was a genuine mistake but a very nice gesture nevertheless, which we appreciated. The room: The room on the first floor was not as big as on the ground floor but as it was higher up, so the noise from the passing trains wasn't as loud. The bed was large and very comfortable. The furnishings were elegant and I would describe the decor as a contemporary take on the Ottoman style. The TV had only one English channel (BBC News) and a few annoying music channels, but we weren't in Istanbul to watch the telly! The en-suite bathroom was absolutely fine with a bath and overhead shower with toiletries replaced daily if we used them. Service: The staff were polite and helpful. Some more than others. The porter was never comfortable with us after the incident of the screaming woman in a towel, which was understandable! :0) Sinan (the chap on reception) was polite and informative but rather reserved. Another young man at the hotel called Murad was similar in his approach. As I mentioned earlier, as part of an offer that was on at the time, for a 7 night stay you got a few free extras. I realised very quickly that unless you don't ask, you don't get. Not a major problem, but it would have been better service for them to have made sure that all parts of the special offer were fulfilled without us having to keep asking. Two members of staff that were there at the time of our stay deserve a special mention from us. A lovely young lady called Ece who shared reception duty with Sinan and a lovely young man called Adnan who always looked after us at breakfast time on the terrace. These two went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and were very welcoming and helpful. Ece gave us lots of good recommendations for things to see and do and was excellent at helping us to decipher maps and directions. Unfortunately, my mobile phone was stolen from my bag without me knowing on a tram journey, and she helped me to find the Tourist Police Station so I could get a report for insurance purposes. Adnan was wonderful too. He really went out of his way for us and actually took us to the souks when he finished his shift at the hotel. He gave up his own time to show us around and make sure we knew how much we should really be paying for things. Haggling in Istanbul was great fun! Everyone you walk past in the souks will try and get you in their shops and when you say 'no, thank you' they ask 'but why?' I'm sure lots of people would find this irritating but I found it really funny and enjoyed the banter and atmosphere. It's all part of the adventure that is Istanbul! Location: The hotel is in a great location in the old Sultanahmet district of Istanbul. It is a 10 minute walk from the stunning Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and pretty much everything else you would want to see in the area. There are plenty of bars/restaurants nearby to try, again about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is close enough to easily access the main attractions of Istanbul but is in just the right spot to make you feel as though you are in a calm, peaceful place away from the hustle and bustle of the centre. The only teeny-tiny niggle that may bother some people about the location was the train tracks directly behind the hotel but it really wasn't a major problem for us, provided you don't have the room on the ground floor! Breakfast: The best thing about breakfast was where it was served. The roof terrace, (open 24 hours a day) provided us with wonderful views of the Blue Mosque at night and the sparkling Marmara Sea in the morning. Adnan was always on hand for a friendly chat and to deliver his usual excellent standard of service. The food itself was nothing to write home about. Although breakfast was buffet style, there really wasn't much to choose from. Boiled eggs, marble cake, a selection of breads, spreads and some pastry type thingies. However, we managed just fine and always ate plenty to make sure we were ready for the day ahead. Concluding notes: This is a perfectly good base to explore the delights of Istanbul from. I've read some recent reviews from people who have stayed more recently and it appears that service has really improved and the teeny-tiny niggly things have been sorted (The hotel was quite new when we stayed). I've given the hotel 4 out of 5 because of the teeny-tiny niggly things we experienced (like being given a bill at check-out when we had pre-paid, luckily I had printed out evidence of our pre- payment or it could have become quite awkward!) but I must say that anyone considering this hotel should definitely go for it. The pros far outweigh the one or two cons.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: soozib
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel are brilliant. They are attentive to your every need and invariably have a smile for you. Ece Acar, at reception, is always ready to spend time giving ideas for visits and helpful hints for getting around the city. The hotel is ideally placed for seeing the sights and it is a short walk to the tram, the bazaar and the Bosphorus for the boat trips. The buffet breakfast is very good and from the terrace on the top of the building the view of the Blue Mosque is amazing (see photo). Our only complaint was that we had a room on a lower floor at the back of the hotel. The view was awful from the room and the trainline is close, We didn't mind because we spent so little time in the room, which was very clean and comfortable - huge bed! If you think that you would be worried by this ask for a room on an upper floor at the front. I am sure that the staff will oblige if possible. Free, fast Internet access was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly staff + comfy hotel = perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: NyCricket
Reviews.Content: A small, intimate boutique hotel in the heart of the Sultanahmet District. Upon arrival, we were greeted with a warm welcome, a map of the city sites and the offer of turkish delights and tea. We stayed 11 nights in the "Sultan's Room" on the second floor facing the front of the hotel with a view of the Blue Mosque. The room was comfortable with a spacious bathroom and the housekeeping staff were very diligent in cleaning the room every day. The best feature of the hotel is their rooftop terrace. Views of the Marmara Sea with the passing ships on one side and on the other the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. Breakfast was offered in the basement and was basic continental food. Many thanks to the Ferman staff for making our stay enjoyable and for being so helpful with directions to various places, arranging tours, and suggestions on shopping. The entire staff were so very kind in greeting us in our arrival and sending off a fond farewell when leaving. Finally, a special thanks to Erhan Topaloglu at the reception desk for recommending day trips and restaurants and for taking the time on his day off to play the role of tour guide extraordinaire, and show us around areas of Istanbul that we would normally not have seen on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel in an excellent location for exploring Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: overlanders_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within a ten-minute walk of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Mosaic Museum and the Sultanahmed metro station, with its own local Bazaar. Plenty of good and reasonable eating places and shops. We had an ocean room which is comfortable and looks out over the Sea of Mamara. A train line passes between the hotel and the sea but there are no trains at night so it is not too intrusive. We were there during the volcanic ash flight disruptions and the staff couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, cozy, clean, friendly and extremely accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: kamillam1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The staff were really nice and accommodating. The service was impeccable. It's a small cozy hotel, but the rooms resemble doubletree accommodations. Everything is new and/or updated. Even though I booked a regular room and my family booked a superior room (sultan room), as soon as we got there, the reception updated me to a sultan room right next to my family. I thought that was really nice of them. I didn't even ask. They were also really helpful in suggesting places to visit/eat and called to confirm all of our tours and reservations and ordered cars, etc. They offer breakfast every morning. It's simple, but has something for everyone. They have a cappuccino machine in the breakfast room, and the chocolate cappuccino is really good. The location is great too. It's walking distance from all of the main attractions in the old city such as the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and the Egyptian obelisques. Itâ€™s also walking distance from the waterfront. There are also cute little shops all around. I would definitely stay here again if I went back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommended”
Reviews.Author: JGMorgado
Reviews.Content: I've been using TripAdvisor for choosing my holidays hotels for several years. However, this is the first time I'm posting a review since I felt Ferman Hotel truly deserve it. The location is very convenient, next to Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque. The rooms are very good and the terrace (open 24h) is wonderful. At last, and in my opinion the hotel's best attribute, the staff! They were really amazing and helpful, making us feel like at a friend's home.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, good location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: SelinaHampshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 week with our 7 year old son, Great location in charming old part of town, view of the Blue mosque from the window and from tiny balcony, (Room 406) and only 5 minutes to the Blue mosque/Hagia Sophia. Young staff were lovely, very welcoming, helpful and particularly kind to our son, in particular Ece the Receptionist and the two waiters who made a great fuss of him every time they saw him. Hotel decor looked new - immaculate and extremely clean. Enormous bed, clean towels every day. Breakfast was in a small dining room in the basement and there was a roof top restaurant which had fantastic views and would be wonderful in the summer. Definitely recommend and very happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Buch78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a week from 07/04/10 until 14/04/10. The hotel is spotlessly clean and all the staff very helpful, even trying to teach me some Turkish! The view from the roof terrace has to be seen to be believed, 360 degree aspect. Our room was comfortable, huge bed, and we had clean towels every day. Breakfast was in the downstairs restaurant as it was not yet warm enough to be on the roof. There was a good selection of food. Perhaps some English breakfast tea bags would be good addition but there were all sorts of herbal and fruit teas and good coffee. The hotel is situated in an ideal position to explore the surrounding attractions, many within walking distance and, if not, the tram takes you to most other areas. We spent a day seeing the Prince's Islands, another on the Bosphorous. The other days we visited all the usual places--Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia, Spice market, Grand bazaar etc. We spent one night at the Orient restaurant to see Turkish dancing, good value for money. We did find a lot of the restaurants near the hotel had very pushy sales people and as a result we didn't use them. One that did let us browse in peace was Kathisma. We ate there twice and it was excellent. Another hidden gem is the garden of the Green House Hotel where you can have lunch/ a drink in beautiful surroundings listening to classical music. We were in Istanbul at the time of the Tulip festival and the tulips and other spring flowers were amazing. Thanks to everyone at the Ferman for making our stay in Istanbul so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectations - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fridgeStockholm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ferman Hotel in March 2010. I travelled to Istanbul with work for a mini conference and therefore booked 9 rooms for 3 nights. All our rooms were exceptionally good, having a standard that exceeded our expectations. They were very spacious, clean (to the point of looking almost new), beautifully furnished, and of a very high standard. The hotel is perfectly located, right in the heart of Sultanhamet. I was a little worried when seeing a railway track not far from my window (maybe 150m away), but i can honestly say that i never heard a thing. The staff a re extremely friendly, and very helpful, even before our arrival. They arranged an airport transfer without extra charge. Even helped in trying to find football tickets. All in all i don't have a single complaint about the hotel. I will definitely come back to this hotel. Stockholm, Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Ottoman heaven!”
Reviews.Author: MattR2005
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1:30am but check in was fine. Beautifully adorned rooms with Ottoman features. Excellent views of the Blue Mosque. Very friendly staff. Good location in the middle of the Sultahmet district near bazaars, mosques, St Sofia and the Topkapi Palace. Rooms look like web site photos - beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “poor experience”
Reviews.Author: borntotravel56
Reviews.Content: Based on tripadvisor reviews we looked forward to our 3 day stay at the Ferman Hotel. Although the hotel had some good points--the roof top terrace and general location were on the plus side-- the service was wanting. We booked a Sultan's room two months ahead on the basis of the website description of a balcony and a small seating area. We also requested a double. Instead we arrived to a twin room with none of the advertised features of a sultan's room. When we inquired we were met with sarcastic comments about not being able to build a balcony on the room. When confronted with the website desription we were finally offered an oceanview room for the last night and a free airport transfer. The value of each of these did not make up for the fact that we overpaid for 2 nights with no offer of a refund. When checking out it was suggested that next time we specify that we want a balcony and sofa-- notwithstanding that the web description identified these as a feature of this room category. We were also referred to two restaurants. Although the first was nice the second was dreadful. All in all very anticlimatic and disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: richardwb
Reviews.Content: Extremely polite, courteous and helpful staff. Rooms clean, tidy and as advertised. Easy walking distance to main attractions of Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HWCArizona
Reviews.Content: The service at the Ferman was exceptional and everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. The price of the room was very reasonable so I decided to upgrade to the best room in the hotel. We were on the top floor and the room had a large terrace overlooking the water. The Ferman is on the European side of Istanbul but from the terrace, we could see the Asian side. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable but the view from the terrace was one of the highlights of our stay at the Ferman. Istanbul is a very large city but the area where the Ferman is located is right in the middle of the historic area. You can walk to almost every historic site from your hotel. The only negative thing I can say about the Ferman is that the breakfast was not exceptional. We plan to return to Istanbul next year and we plan to stay at the Ferman. There are many small hotels in the area but I highly recommend the Ferman.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful boutique hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveler065
Reviews.Content: The Ferman is perfectly located in the Old City within walking distance of the classic Istanbul sites. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The staff is very helpful and attentive. We had to leave before the breakfast room was open and we were served a very ice Turkish breakfast in our room at exactly the requested time.We like to stay at boutique hotels when we can and the Ferman is a gem of this type.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KatB15
Reviews.Content: Ferman Hotel was booked as part of package through www.lastminute.com - this is the second time I've used this website and 100% success so far for all services booked. Ferman hotel is a wonderful 24 bedroom property located a few minutes behind the famous Blue Mosque - so close that when we got lost on our first day, we were able to use the Mosque to find our way back without incident. Located in the historic quarter of Istanbul, Sultanhamet, the Ferman is close to lots of must-see sights and attractions - Blue Mosque, Hag Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Aresta Baazar, Grand Baazar, all within easy strolling distance. Plenty of restaurants and the odd bar in the vicinity too. Rooms: Given a large suite on ground floor - views out over Bosphorus and Sea of Marmara from small balcony. Decor beautiful. Beds extremely comfortable - along with all furniture in room. Only negative thing I can think of is that shower head came off on first day, but was fixed by the time we got back that afternoon; If you're a light sleeper, you're probably not going to have any sleep-ins in Istanbul due to the frequent calls to Prayers, but would suggest asking for room at front of Ferman hotel as trains at back of hotel can be loud - only if you're a very light sleeper though. Staff: All staff spoke English and were most helpful - 100%! This goes for the general public in Istanbul as well - everybody wants to help you get to where you need to be (and so what if they're trying to sell you something along with it - it's all done with the utmost courtesy). Staff arranged site-seeing, boat trips, airport transfers, even a birthday cake! I cannot recommend or thank them enough for looking after us so fantastically. Ferman hotel has a roof-top terrace with great views out over the Blue Mosque, Hag Sophia and Sea of Marmara but March is a bit chilly in Istanbul - I imagine it would be a fantastic place to watch the sun set in the summer months! Dining room located in the basement - ample breakfast choice to suit all appetites. Photo's will be added shortly to this review.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,super friendly staff and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: alexparosfan
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel by luck.The guy at front desk-Erhan was so nice an made a special deal for us.The room was large,very clean and nicely decorated.The hotel location is really comfortable and you can find nice little restaurants near by.The young lady at the reception whose name is Ece was very halpful and organize us a taxi and transportation to the airport.We loved the place and we hardly recommend it.We will be back....K&J frm Greece

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably good”
Reviews.Author: VikmanshyttanDeen
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I visited Istanbul and I could have had a better start. Arrived in Istanbul and Ferman hotel on Monday afternoon and Tuesday evening, I was robbed by taxi driver who drove me from the workplace back to the hotel. But luckily I got was a great help to the hotel manager Serkant Kaval, who helped me with the police when I reported rÃ¥net.Jag would also like to thank Erhan Topaloglu, who worked the front desk, for all the support during my continued stay in istanbul. I will recommend this hotel Ferman to those who are going to visit Istanbul. Urban Bergman from Sweden.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully friendly hotel, with excellent value for money in the heart of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rob_of_Kalkan
Reviews.Content: We used TripAdvisor to help us book our short break for our party of nine people and we were not disappointed with the Ferman Hotel. Ece, the hotel receptionist was incredibly helpful before our trip even began in organising our transfers from Sabiha GÃ¶kÃ§en Airport. She was equally helpful in recommending and booking local restaurants for us. The hotel is in a perfect location not five minutesâ€™ walk from Sultanahmet (The Blue Mosque), Ayasofya (Saint Sophia), the Cisterns and Topkapi Palace. There are also some really nice restaurants with plenty of atmosphere just one road up. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to anyone and we are already thinking of excuses to make another trip back as soon as possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: eltop1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ferman Hotel, Istanbul with my husband during a short 3-day leisure break. The location of the hotel is ideal, right next to all major historic sights. The hotel was cozy and comfortable. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The difference maker of this hotel was the service provided, which was excellent. When we arrived, the reception officer Mr. Erhan Topaloglu, was so kind to upgrade our room to a suite! He was also very willing to always help us book restaurants, find info on ferries, suggest attractions etc making our stay way less complicated. The rest of the staff was also very smiling, helpful and polite giving to the hotel a very very positive atmosphere. What could be impoved is the breakfast selection, but again the staff in charge was very helpful and polite. I would definetely recommend this hotel because it successfully combines service & location.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not hesitate to stay at the Ferman Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jc100m
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ferman Hotel for a week in early February and couldn't have been any happier with the experience. Accustomed to staying in nicer hotels in the states, we were unsure what to expect. Upon arrival, we were shown 5 different room types (honestly, all of them looked great) and decided in the interest of money and general room similarity to go with the "Sultans Room" (Contained a King sized bed, not two twins spliced together as is customary in many European hotels, a flat screen television of roughly 32 inches, a small balcony overlooking a quiet street and the Blue Mosque, a nice bathroom w/ a shower that had excellent water pressure, and individual remote control climate control), or the 2nd tier of rooms. The Sultans Room appeared identical to the "Ocean's Room" (one price tier higher) other than the obvious difference in view. As others have mentioned, the service at this hotel is truly wonderful. Our first day, being jet lagged, my wife slept in until 10 am, while I had already grabbed breakfast from the hotel. Although an hour past when breakfast was due to end, upon leaving the hotel to start our day, Ece (a true testament to the hotel's staff, and always a welcome face at the front desk) asked my wife if she wanted to grab breakfast as they had kept it open knowing that she had yet to eat. Wow, seriously?!! The location of the hotel was also really ideal for those who want to see the historic sights that Istanbul has to offer. A short walk uphill and through the Arasta Bazaar finds you face to face with the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. The Basillica Cistern as well as the tramway are also quite close (The Basillica is roughly 400 meters from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque and is adjacent to the Sultanahmet tram stop which can be used to get to the ferries or funicular to get to Taksim Square). Also, there are roughly 20 - 30 restaurants within 4 city blocks of the hotel. Again, the location really can't be beat. I am a very picky individual, and as far as this hotel is concerned I really couldn't find any downside. Is this hotel good for the price? Definitely, and then some. In all honesty, a similar hotel would cost you at least $200/nt in the states if it were located in the heart of a major city. The biggest complaint an individual could potentially have would be the call to prayer, but again, if you have a problem with this then Istanbul probably isn't the place for you. The 6 am call woke my wife or I up a couple of days, but we found ourselves amazed versus annoyed. Unless completely sound proofed, I don't know that any hotel in Sultanahmet is oblivious to this. As my header states, please don't hesitate to stay at the Ferman Hotel! If you have any further questions about the hotel or area in general, feel free to drop me a meassage.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kyreada
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ferman Hotel for 3 nights. Together with my boss, we really liked the room where we stayed. Just nice for two people, and it's very comfortable and cozy. Most of all, we loved the customer service given to us by their staff. If given the chance to go back to Istanbul, i will still stay in Ferman Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why wouldn't you stay here?!”
Reviews.Author: MariyahBegum
Reviews.Content: Wikipedia definition .. " ferman is a royal mandate or decree issued by a sovereign in certain historical Islamic states, including the Ottoman Empire" .. hence the books in the lobby and the framed artwork. Loved the room and location .. faultless. It's only been open about 18 months .. perhaps that's why it's still in good nick. Regardless, comfy beds, perfectly clean with polite and helpful staff. It's located in a little area that sells kilims and carpets .. very close to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Convenient for getting to and from places by foot and absolutely safe. Plus .. a sweet little cafe ideal for sipping apple tea and enjoying a Shisha. If you get a chance head to the port .. near the spice market and eat at the Hamdi restaurant .. great views. Oh yes .. and free high-speed Wi-Fi to boot!!

Reviews.Title: “We liked the hotel very much and would choose it again for our next trip”
Reviews.Author: carnavalBern
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful : between the Blue Moschee and the Bosphorus, near most cultural highlights. The terrace is stupendous. The staff is really nice and helpful. We had interesting chats with a few of them, especially with the charming Ece.This part of Istanbul is very touristic : be careful when you choose a restaurant because you usually get touristic food, more or less the same everywhere. It works, at least for the owners, il you consider the luxurious cars parked in front of them ! We recommand the fish restaurant about 100 meters away (Ece knows it) and the modest but authentic Istamblue which delivers lunch to various shop's owners. Anne-Marie and FranÃ§ois

Reviews.Title: “Good location, cosey stay”
Reviews.Author: PortMoodyCouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ferman hotel for 4 nights and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was clean, in an excellent location, close to restaurants, shopping, and the main sites, including blue mosque and haghia sophie. The staff were extremely respectful and nice. Breakfast was included in our stay and we also thoroughly enjoyed that... cheese, olives, cereal etc...

Reviews.Title: “perfect for all the sites, clean and comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterBunny1
Reviews.Content: We had a great couple of days at the Ferman. The staff are the friendliest you could ask for. Room comfortable, clean and with lovely views. We even had a free glass of bubbly on new years eve. turkish delight and pastries available free of charge in the lobby every day and within 5 mins of the blue mosque, aya sofya museum etc. a super fish restaurant within 2 mins walk too.

Reviews.Title: “nice young hotel with promise”
Reviews.Author: Seattle98119
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of the Sulthamet District - we could see the minarets of the Blue Mosque from our balcony. It's new with very nice decor. The room was small but very comfortable. Staff was very young, upbeat, and solicitous, but no one knew much English or much about touring Istanbul. Problems were small ; they never had change for large bills at the front desk, the piped-in music was too loud in the hallways (they were always ready to turn it down at our daily request). The breakfast was very good. I would recommend it hoping the staff gets a bit more training in English and that they deal with these small issues.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: daniel1981
Reviews.Content: The ferman hotel is conveniently located in the Sultanhamed district, in walking distance to most sights (the blue mosque, hagia sophia and the sunken palace). Taksim area (where Istanbul's night life is happening) can be reached by tramvay and "funikulÃ¤r" in about 20 minutes, or by taxi (~12 TL). Since we wanted to do some of the mandatory sightseeing, but also go out to bars and clubs, this was perfect for us. We had a Sultan's room and stayed for about a week to celebrate New Year's Eve in Istanbul. The hotel looked very new, I think it opened about a year ago. The hotel rooms were decorated in "ottoman style" (it looked very posh, with a nice ceiling lamp and everything), the bathroom was clean and modern. When arriving at the hotel, the receptionist Elhanaden and me sat down for a welcome drink and he was going to tell me about the activities and tours possible in Istanbul. I had already been in Istanbul in summer, so instead we chatted about travelling experiences through India and Southeast-Asia. For New Year's Eve, none of the activities suggested by the hotel really interested us (like going on a boat trip), so the receptionist Ece spontaneously decided to invite us to join her and her family to go to a club in the Taksim area. So we celebrated New Year's Eve with her and enjoyed it very much. We usually slept very long. The breakfast buffet was officially open from 7.30 to 10.30 am. We arrived roughly at noon, since we had been out the night before. They re-opened the breakfast buffet only for us, we were very thankful for that :-) The view from the hotel terrace on the Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosque is beautiful. Unfortunately it was a bit chilly during winter time (the terrace was open 24/7 though and service was available). We've been told that the hotel wants to put a glass roof on the terrace during winter time and add a small fitness room in the basement. The hotel is definately a good one - modern, clean, good location, great service. We've been treated nothing but nice. We would go there again on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, lovely hotel, what more could we ask for?”
Reviews.Author: Ra76London
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Ferman Hotel and were greeted by the friendly staff who were happy to give us recommendations of eating places and what to visit on our short stay. Our room was lovely, the decor tastefully done and room size was good. Our room had a small balcony overlooking the street which was a nice feature. The Hotel is centrally located in the Sultanahmet area a short walk away from the Blue Mosque and the Sofia Mosque and the Grand Bazaar as well as the museums. We did try the Turquiose Restaurant which was recommended by the hotel staff, the food was delicious especially the calamari. Definitely recommend the Ferman Hotel to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home but without the worries of doing the chores. Fantastic view at the Roof Terrace”
Reviews.Author: frankiek4
Reviews.Content: A very neat hotel. Service staff are all very warm and caring. Our stay was really enjoyable, starting the day with a good spread of breakfast delights with the staff occasionally giving us ideas on where to visit. The roof terrace is very scenic but due to Winter, our breakfast was at the lower basement but this was fine with us. The staff had told us that they will be enclosing the roof terrace and installing heaters so that breakfast can be served at the roof terrace. Good thoughts and enticing for us to return again. The room is spacious and beds were really comfortable. All our check-in/out was done fuss free and the airport transfers was nicely arranged. Keep up the good work. We'll return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: snoju
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ferman Hotel because of its price and location, and reviews here. After an initial hiccup when we arrived, we were given an excellent room, with outstanding views of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia. I mention this because it was typical of the effort the staff made throughout our visit to make us happy. A digression - you need very good directions for the taxi driver when you arrive at the airport (or anywhere else); street addresses in Istanbul are actually not that useful, so make sure you print directions out for the taxi driver. This is a "boutique" hotel, the sort of thing we usually shy away from because many places use that description to get away with tiny, sort of exotic rooms and decoration - but in this case you don't have to worry. The rooms are a good size, the breakfast is good, and as I said the staff worked very hard to make us happy. It is a relatively new hotel, and they are working hard to compete successfully. The best part of our stay was that we ended up with visa problems, and had to call from the airport to see if they could take us back, and they did very quickly and happily, commenting that we were like family. Very nice! Anyway, our stay extended another week, and we couldn't have been happier. The wireless internet works very well - more and more an essential of travel, I find. The Sea of Marmara and Bosphorus are a five minute walk away, and there is an excellent concrete walk along the water if you are a runner, which I am, so exercise was easy. In difficult circumstances, this ended up being a very pleasurable base for a stay in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “friendly luxury hotel at 4 star prices”
Reviews.Author: plummety
Reviews.Content: Agonised for ages about whether to book this hotel as there are so many others to choose from but it lived up to it's Trip Advisor rating. We upgraded to a junior suite which was a good size and very lavishly decorated. The staff were all very helpful and friendly - as other people have said nothing is too much for them. Ece Acar in hotel reception was especially helpful. As it is winter we ate breakfast downstairs at basement level. In the summer they have it on the rooftop. I would recommend you go up there anyway as the view is spectacular.We ate out most of the time. The food in Sultanahmet is mediocre however there is a brilliant curry house a few doors up from the Ferman which I would totally recommend. I think it is called Moda or something like that. The only negative thing I would have to say is that our room had a railway line outside it which was a bit noisy so I would ask for a room at the front. A lot of the hotels in this area are built along the railway line. We liked Istanbul very much and will probably go back in the summer and we will stay at the Ferman. Lizzie and Paul

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: mebs5
Reviews.Content: Great Location, value for money,staff very courteous and helpful especially the manager Sinan who went out of his way to make our stay enjoyable and arranging tours for us. Our room was clean and spacious and breakfast was good. Would certainly stay here again if we were to visit Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A jem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ann049
Reviews.Content: I must echo all the positive reviews of this hotel. We were treated as valued guests and the staff always went the extra mile. The location is ideal. The room was large and welcoming and had an exceptionally comfortable bed. The view from the terrace is breathtaking. The most outstanding thing however is the level of service. The staff couldn't do enough for us. When we returned from a busy day of sightseeing they would offer us an apple tea and want to know how our day had gone. I had informed them that I was celebrating a significant birthday. To my surprise there was a knock on the door and a cake with lit candles and a bottle of wine was presented, accompanied by lots of congratulations. When we left to go to the airport the staff all came out to wish us off. We really felt well looked after and would certainly stay there again if we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful room and brilliant location,lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: daisyEssex
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a brilliant location near to the blue mosque and aya sofia. that means that you will be woken by the call to prayer early in the morning but that is part of the magic. I would suggest a room overloooking Sutanamet rather than at the back but all are beautifully done and the staff are so helpful. the view from the terace is awesome and once it is partially covered then breakfast will be served there all year round. Well done to all the staff and I would definitely go there again

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous - felt like home instantly”
Reviews.Author: peeks2009
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprise from the moment I stepped in , and was warmly greeted - and showed to my penthouse room with an awesome view of the blue mosque. Breakfast was just right and not too elaborate - Sinan and Ece were gracious to my every request and the bell boys walked the second mile to make sure I was ok. They were my first impressions of Turkey - down to earth , humble , gentle and sincere. Definitely coming back here for my next visit and will definitely stay at the Ferman.

Reviews.Title: “A nice small friendly place”
Reviews.Author: NoniLahore
Reviews.Content: It is at a walking distance from Blue mosque,Topkapi,Hayasofia and even grand bazaar. Walk to these sites is convenient.The staff is very friendly. The tamline next to the hotel is a negative point for some rooms.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: mobAhford
Reviews.Content: The 6 nights spent in istanbul were superb made more so very special by the help and support of the team of Ferman hotel. Istanbul is a magical city made more so by the staff organising a personal guide for a day at a very reasonable rate for theBlue Mosque, Sofya and Dolmabache Palace, orgainsing tickets for the Bosphorous cruise and evening entertaiment again at lower then the prevailing market rates. The hotel itself is very clean, warm and welcoming, ideally located in a quite though few yards from the Blue Mosque with superb view from the roof top. Special thanks to Cinan Erdogan, Ece, Murat, Alpar and Serkat for their friendly, courteous and willingness to make things happen as we wanted them to be. A memory that will remain with us through our lives.

Reviews.Title: “the best little hidden Gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: colonystar
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights at the Ferman and would have liked to have stayed longer...the elegance of the hotel is subtle. The room was extra clean, extra large with a sitting area, and extra comfortable--great bed--modern large bathroom, the view from our terrace of the Saltanahmet Mosque was unbelievable. the breakfast, included in price, was excellent and the views of the Bosphorus from the terrace were breathtaking. but the best part was the people who run the hotel--they took us under their wing and treated us like a king and queen! the receptionist could not do enough for us...and the valet was so concerned about us that the day of our departure at 6Am he came early to work to deliver breakfast to our room!!! Even the maids could not do enough...I want to go back and see all the friends we made at the Ferman--everyone was wonderful--they even put out homemade cookies and candies with juice all day!!! Don't miss this experience! In the best location--next to restaurants, shops, and a great bazaar!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: massimo_pl
Reviews.Content: Superb staff greeted us as we arrived and detailed what to do and where to go in the city, including which sites were open/closed on certain days - all this whilst being served an excellent complimentary tea. Our room, ocean double was very spacious, very clean, and well furnished, with complimentary fresh fruit, water and turkish delight as a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable petit hotel like my home”
Reviews.Author: Rdubai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ferman hotel for 2 nights in the later October. The weather was perfect and I really enjoyed my stay in Istanbul thanks to Ferman hotel. The location is perfect, 5 minutes to Blue Mosq and Ayasophia, and there are lots of restaurants to eat nearby but the hotel itself is in very quiet area. The roof top terrace where they serve breakfast and drinks at night has amazing view of the mosq and also ocean and we really enjoyed. I stayed in Ocean room which has nice ocean view, so I recommend to book upper floor where the room has nice view. The room is very clean and comfortable size. More than anything, people of Ferman hotel has warmest hospitality and we felt like at home, even my 3 year daughter enjoyed her stay too!

Reviews.Title: “A welcome port in a storm”
Reviews.Author: Dunmoreuk
Reviews.Content: We ended up in Istanbul on one of the worst weekends of the year weatherwise. It rained incessantly. Thankfully Hotel Firman was a most pleasant and welcome retreat. Its a small hotel but has first class service and our room was spacious and comfortable. The staff could not have been more helpfu. ,From giving restaurant advice, and arranging tours, to finally sorting out a reliable and cheap transit to the airport - nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is very well situated and all the major sites are within walking distance. We would definitely go back - but nextt time we want them to arrange the weather as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Decor”
Reviews.Author: ErinandJon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ferman Hotel a few weeks ago for three nights. The location is unbeatable. The Marmara Sea on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other. Upon check-in, we were told our room was unavailable due to a water issue, so we were upgraded to a beautiful suite at no extra charge. All of Istanbul's tourist attractions are less than a five-minute walk, yet it is nice and quiet inside the hotel. However, the only reason I did not give five stars is the walls/ceilings were a bit thin, so I could hear the scratching of the patio chairs above us when people were eating breakfast. But, if you are an early riser, this shouldn't be a problem. All in all, great place with a friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with friendly and effecient staff. Well located for all the main tourist attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Navigator067
