Reviews.Content: This hotel met and exeeded all our expectations. The hotel was clean and very well located for all the main tourist sites. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Amazing views from the roof top terrace . My eight year old daughter thoroughly enjoyed her stay and was happy with variety of food available at breakfast. On arrival at the hotel check in was trouble free and were were lucky enough to be upgraded to the Sultans Suite. The room was very big and had a great view of the blue Mosque. Istanbul is a great place with so much to see and do, just make sure you take a pair of comfortable shoes as the best way to see everything is to walk. They operate a Tram system which is easy to use a very cheap. If you venture out of the main tourist area you will find that eating out is cheaper but just as good. You don't have to go to far just another 10 minutes further out. Our thanks and appreciation to all at the Ferman Hotel for making it such an enjoyable and memorable holiday. We hope to return next year. Hussain Family (Reading)

Reviews.Title: “The Ferman Hotel ADDS to the magic that is Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: OldSoftee
Reviews.Content: On our first trip ever to Turkey, a friend and I had no idea at all where to stay. An acquaintance recommened the Ferman Hotel in Sultanahmet, and it could not have been a better suggestion. The facilities are thoroughly modern and impeccably well-kept. The facility is as charming as a vacation boutique hotel needs to be. The rooms were clean, well-equipped and ours had an excellent balcony that was most suitable for a post-sightseeing cold refreshment. Also, there's a spacious rooftop terrace with bar, that has a spectacular view of the Blue Mosque. But the facilities are only a part of what makes the Ferman Hotel a great choice. The staff is young, vibrant, remarkably helpful and project that famous Turkish friendliness. The front desk hosts, Ece and Sinan, work tirelessly to make sure that your every need is addressed. The same is true for the bell staff, the breakfast and bar attendants and housekeeping. Top notch, all the way! Sultanahmet is the BEST place to base your tourist activities while in Istanbul - albeit not the least expensive. It's walking distance from ALL major attractions; Topkapi Palace (DON'T miss it), the Blue Mosque, Ayasofia, the Grand Bazaar, the Spice Bazaar and more. There are GREAT restaurants everywhere, and no lack of things to see and do (and MANY great aromas of fabulous Turkish cuisine). Check out the Ferman Hotel's web site or call them directly. They'll be happy to take care of you, and you'll be happy that they did!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and exceptional staff - why go anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: MoucheToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ferman Hotel for a total of 5 nights, split over a couple of weeks by travel elsewhere in Turkey. We simply canâ€™t say enough good things about it. The Hotel was modern inside and spotlessly clean and our room bigger than we expected and very comfortable (the slippers are a nice touch). There is a wonderful rooftop terrace with an exceptional view of the Blue Mosque on one side and the Bosphorous on the other, and where they serve a very good varied and quite hearty breakfast. There are always pastries and Turkish Delight available in the lobby, with juice or water, and there is always someone on hand to provide coffee, tea or other beverages â€“ all you have to do is ask (and really, it is often hard to beat them to the punch because the staff is always offering up something as soon as you walk in the door). And you canâ€™t beat the location â€“ a few minutesâ€™ walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar and a whole host of restaurants. Yes, it is true that there is a commuter train that runs behind the Hotel quite frequently, but even with a room on the train side of the building you can barely hear it when the windows are shut and, for us, it quickly became background white noise and was not bothersome in any way. As good as the facility itself was, what made the Hotel particularly special was the exceptional kindness, helpfulness, hospitality and warmth of all of the staff: Sinan Erdogan (the front office manager), Ece, Ayda, Alper and Emine (I am truly sorry I donâ€™t know everyoneâ€™s last name). We corresponded with Sinan on several occasions before and during our trip, and he always responded very quickly with the information we were looking for. We were never at a loss for suggestions about things to do or places to go, but no one was pushy about directing us to any particular merchant or service provider. Just two examples of the amazing â€œabove and beyond the callâ€� service we received: First, when we wanted to take the tram one evening Sinan gave us his transit pass because he thought it would be easier for us to avoid having to locate where we could buy tokens â€“ now, these passes are ones that you have to pay to â€œfill upâ€�, yet he wouldnâ€™t accept any kind of payment from us. Second, on our last day in Turkey we had an early flight out, which meant leaving the hotel at about 6:00 am before the normal breakfast period. Still, staff made sure that breakfast was all laid out and coffee and eggs available for us so that we could eat before leaving. If I ever have the good fortune to travel to Istanbul again, I wouldnâ€™t stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great location and service, 360 degree view from breakfast terrace”
Reviews.Author: DalyaHakimi
Reviews.Content: The Service in this hotel was excellent especially Sinan Erdogan who took our reservation over the phone negotiated a better price for the top room and had us picked up from the airport with excellent transportation. He always was there to provide any service we needed and was a great help in every way possible. He knew our names and the hotel felt like family. The driver had a sign with our name and it was a big roomy van. Breakfast every morning was tasty and fresh and served on the rooftop dining area which had 360 degree views. We had amazing views of the blue Mosque the Hagia Sofia, Istanbul and the harbors and boats and all that. The room was very large and beautifully decorated with a comfortable sofa and side chairs, lovely interior decoration, on the top floor with a great balcony but did not have the amenities needed in a room that size and in that price range.For example, there was no way to deal with the noise of the train that passed periodically all day and night and the calling to prayer from the mosque woke us up every day at 6 am . Although there were lovely night tables with a drawer and storage compartment, there was no chest of drawers for underwear and tops and such. Also there was no full length mirror anywhere in the room. There was no clock and the desk did not have a desk lamp or drawer. Also the bathroom was adequate and nicely finished with porcelain tiles that looked like stone but it did not have even a small shelf for toiletries or a soap dish or tissue box in the bathroom or anywhere in the room. No moisture cream and the soaps are tiny. Also there was no way to turn off the light on the balcony which was located near the head of the bed and shone right in my eyes. The curtain over the window was just a sheer and did not help to soften the light which was in my face at night. My husband went out and disconnected the bulb! the one morning we needed a wake up call the night desk person forgot. It was a big problem because we got up the last minute and had privately arranged an expensive tour guide to pick us up early. However, Sinan even offered to fire the person who made the mistake but we said no. Instead he arranged transportation for us back to the airport as a very reasonable compensatoin for this problem. Since we left late at night but checked out early, the hotel watched our suitcases for us and then Sinan had fresh tea for us while we waited for the van and talked. It felt like we were staying with friends! The cleanliness was impeccable except for one day of our four days. they did not replace our used up soaps and left the messy tiny piece of soap on the counter.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great views, great location!”
Reviews.Author: jfreedy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Istanbul for 5 nights and the Ferman Hotel was the perfect spot in a fantastic city. The staff was terrific. Super friendly and helpful, including trying to help us track down some lost luggage (we didn't get it, but it wasn't for a lack of trying). The rooftop views were amazing, as was the view from our balcony on the top floor. The location, in Sultanahmet, was perfect. Short walking distance to all the major tourist sites, and easy access to public transportation to visit the rest of this incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay at the Ferman again - it's a gem”
Reviews.Author: WhyITravel
Reviews.Content: Having done extensive research on Tripadvisor and other internet sites about hotels in Istanbul, the Ferman Hotel seemed to be a clear winner, and I was not disappointed. Located on a picturesque street between the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous, the Ferman is a real gem. It still feels brand new and is absolutely spotlessly clean. I stayed in a very large room off the lobby - loved the furnishings which are modern but have a little bit of opulent bling (e.g. the trendy chandelier-style light fittings and silver sofa!). Much has been said on here about the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff and I agree wholeheartedly. Many thanks to Sinan, Ece and the rest of the staff for making my stay so pleasant. There were some little touches too that made the Ferman extra special - from the hotel-branded complimentary toiletries and slippers, etc. (even the tissue box has the hotel's gold and burgundy branding) to the platter of fruit in my room, and trays of Turkish delight and fresh pastries that tempted me each time I passed through the lobby. Complimentary cherry (yum!) and orange juice was also available in the lobby and the juice and tea/coffee facilities from the breakfast buffet remain available to guests on the roof terrace throughout the day. I arrived after a long journey and was immediately offered a cold drink to refresh me, which was thoughtful. Breakfast was perfectly adequate (try the hot chocolate from the Nescafe machine - yum!) but the food itself is far surpassed by the spectacular roof terrace, which has 360 degree views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Sea of Marmara. Being up on the terrace at sunset with the calls to prayer from the surrounding mosques ringing in the air is truly memorable. There is also a bar on the roof at which, during my stay, I met several people who were staying at nearby hotels and who had spotted it and wanted to come over as it looked much nicer than the terraces where they were staying! The Ferman hotel is located around the corner from a street full of restaurants which cater to tourists - the tables spill out onto the pavement and make for a festive atmosphere. You can get a decent, basic meal for around 20 lira (excluding alcoholic drinks which are pretty steep - mojitos at one place were 25 lira each!). You can also easily arrange a hotel shuttle (10 lira) from the travel shops in the area - they will also arrange tours for you, or ask at Reception and the Ferman staff will happily do the same. The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia are about a 5 min walk away, with the Topkapi Palace just a few minutes further. It takes less than 10 min to walk to the Sultanahmet tram station which connects you to the rest of the city. It is also possible to walk to the Grand Bazaar in about 15 min (wear comfy shoes though - Istanbul is hilly and many of the roads are cobbled). There are also several mini-markets near the hotel if you want to stock up on basics like water and confectionery. The Sultanahmet area seems to be very safe - as a woman on my own I had no problem walking around at night - other than fending off entreaties from ardent shopowners to come and see their carpets/leather goods/other! :-) My only complaint was that my room was not very soundproof - being off the lobby, there was quite a bit of noise as people came and went . Also, I could hear people walking around (the floors are not carpeted) and a baby crying in the room above me - and people in the next room talking loudly at 2.30am. Funnily enough, the noise from the trains that run on the track behind the hotel did not bother me at all (easier to tune out?). I did ask to be moved but the hotel was fully booked - the staff were very apologetic that they were unable to move me. I would definitely stay at the Ferman again though - I'd just request a quieter room. It is excellent value for money (pay in cash and you get 10% off your bill) and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: kazbek99
Reviews.Content: My brother and me stood in Ferman Hotel in October 2009 for 5 days. Our conclusion: Excellent!!! Perfect location (Sultanahmed district), Brand new appliances, freshly renovated European-style rooms, quiet, comfortable building, fantastic rooftop: you are eating your complimentary breakfast and observing the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Bosfor at the same time! Hotel is SO well kept and manicured - all because of extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff: Sinan Erdogan, Ayda, Alper, Emine - guys, THANK YOU VERY MUCH!!! You are the best - I'll see you next September. the only tip I can give to other travellers, beside the choice of hotel, is the Turquoise restaurant - just a block away from Ferman hotel. This place offers the same choice of Turkish and quasi-European food as all other places around, but with two important distinctions: matured, knowledgeable staff and fantastic kitchen - you'll be pleasantly surprised with they calamari, lamb and veggie platters. Istanbul, see you next September!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Helpful, friendly Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: cdcarol
Reviews.Content: Sinon Erdogan was so helpful and friendly. I asked for directions to an inter-net cafe, and he smiled and said use my computer. He stored packages for us and had great restaurant ideas. After a long day of touring, it felt good to be welcomed home, by Sinon at the Ferman.

Reviews.Title: “Go ahead and splurge a little bit - this hotel was phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: schen056
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Turkey was based on the following: cheap & cheerful. We didn't want to stay in grimey hotels or hostels with 18 beds in a room, nor could we afford to splurge each night. We actually stayed in a hotel down the road from Ferman but noticed how amazing it looked from the outside. After touring the country we came back to stay one last night and decided we should just splurge on Ferman. The truth is, for only a tad bit more you get what feels like a 5 star experience. Amazing rooms, very roomy, clean & comfy sheets, a TV that works! Amazing bathtub/washroom...just all in all so stunning. The staff is friendly, they put out drinks & treats at the front desk. The best part is that they have the most beautiful rooftop patio with a totally awesome breakfast. The view is amazing (Sea of Marmara on one side, AyaSofay & Blue Mosque on the other). It is really like a european hotel, stunning.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel truly exceeded my best expectations”
Reviews.Author: BeeHouston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at this hotel after a full day of travel. We checked in quite easily and were so pleased to see our room. The hotel is about a year old and the room was very beautiful,spacious, clean, and well arranged. The breakfast included with the room price was very good. It was served on the rooftop of the hotel overlooking the many wonderful sights of the city. However, what really made the hotel special was the wonderful staff. They were so courteous and helpful and answered all of our questions. They went above and beyond what would have been expected. As a specific example, we were in our hotel room for less than one-half hour when my husband realized that he did not have his wallet. He checked all of his pockets, backpack and luggage. He remembered that he had the wallet in the taxi that brought us from the airport to the hotel. He went to the front desk and spoke with the Front Office manager, Sinan Erdogan. Sinan said that he would have the shuttle driver take my husband back to the airport to check for the taxi and its driver to see if the wallet had been found. I remembered a portion of the license number of the taxi (written on the side of the cab as well as on the license plate.) The shuttle driver and my husband went back to the airport and asked at the taxi stand about the specific cab. The number was checked and the taxi people started broadcasting for the driver to check in. The shuttle driver was going to have to stay at the airport to bring back some other guests arriving from England later that evening. Right before my husband was going to take another cab back to the hotel, the taxi driver came back to the airport. The wallet had slipped down between the front seat cushions. As soon as it was found, my husband asked the shuttle driver to call back to the hotel to tell Sinan that he had found the wallet. Sinan called me in our room to report that all had turned out well. Needless to say, our trip was much better after that. We continued to enjoy our visit to Istanbul and we were very pleased that the location of the Ferman was so central to all of the sites we wanted to visit. We were able to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Snorkelsue
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from what turned out to be and extended stay at the Ferman Hotel. We enjoyed our first four nights, said good bye to Sinan and the other caring and helpful staff and went to the airport to discover that a passport was missing. So, we had to return to the Ferman for 3 more nights while getting this taken care of. Sinan found us rooms for all three nights and arranged a gratis transfer back to the airport. We truly felt like this was our home in Istanbul! We stayed in a "Sultan" room for 4 of the nights and a "Ferman" room for 3 nights. The Ferman Room is fine- ours did look onto a train track with frequent trains, but with good windows and earplugs and we slept well. The Sultan room (306) was luxurious and spacious and had a balcony to watch the charming comings and goings on the little street in front of the hotel. The location was perfect for everything. Especially enjoyed eating at Rumist Cafe. Really recommend the hotel and special accolodes to Sinan and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A smart and comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: articulate_this
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is tucked away in a quiet side street but is only moments away from the busy central area of the old city with lots of shops and restaurants and many important sites to visit. Our room was extremely clean and comfortable, service was friendly and unobtrusive. The roof terrance where breakfast is served is just amazing, with an extensive sea view in one direction, and of the Blue Mosque in the other. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Muppet16
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed at the Ferman for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. Istanbul is a fantastic place to visit and the hotel is in the centre of all the action - a few strides to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Cistern etc etc. The staff were all very helpful and happy to advise on places to eat and would book restaurants and taxis for us. We were all very happy with our rooms, the Ocean rooms do have a rail track nearby but the noise didn't really bother us too much. The roof terrace has wonderful views to the Bosphorous and the Blue Mosque and that is where breakfast is served. The staff are charming and Ece was particularly helpful. If you want your 10% discount when paying cash make sure you sort it when you arrive and not on departure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nm404
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as described on Splendia website -we were not disappointed in any way. Location was excellent. The view of the Blue Mosque at sunrise was beautiful. Staff very help and friendly. Would like to say thank you to Ece Acar + the staff whose names I do not know for making our first trip to istanbul a most enjoyable one. Thank you nm404

Reviews.Title: “super good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripperrrr
Reviews.Content: I have often been in Sultanahmet. Ferman hotel has a very good location and it's in a safe environment. I have booked a room but never stayed. I think it's a super good hotel. The pictures are very beautiful. Mr. Sinan Erdogan is very helpful and nice. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “3 sweety day in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HalilBaku
Reviews.Content: In this summer we was in Istanbul with my girl friend. We fined weary lovely Ferman Hotel in historical Sultanahmet aria. Front office team, specially Sinan was weary helpfully. He did hes best to assist us for every subject. We wait for next summer to see that guy again. I recommend every body ferman hotel who planed to realise their holiday in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “nice location , very good staff”
Reviews.Author: kouroshmo
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed there between 01 to 05 Oct. 2009 . The location was so nice just 5 min. walking to Ayasofia , blue mosque , topkapi saray . It is in sultanihmat area that is so nice . The hotel has good staff that give you all useful information you need .

Reviews.Title: “An amazing level of service, quality and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: Journeyman80
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a delightful time in Istanbul and the experience of our trip was made especially special by our stay at the comfortable and luxurious Ferman Hotel. This hotel was not only just a few minutes walk from the wonderful sites of the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace, but on the large roof terrace where we had our scrumptious daily breakfast, we were afforded 360 degree views of these fabulous mosques. A case in point with regard to the top class level of service shown to us, was that having first arrived at the hotel in the late evening we were unable to change our money into Turkish Lira as the Bureau de Change was closed (don't change money at the airport as they charge 4% commission, better to do it in the old town where it is commission free). The dutiful and ever efficient front desk staff member, namely Sinan Erdogan, told us not to worry and produced 250 Turkish Lira from his own wallet and said that we could give it back to him whenever we changed our cash, which allowed us to shop in the local bazaar (it is open quite late) and buy something to eat that evening. This trust and understanding of the staff occurred throughout our stay so that whenever we needed a restaurant to be reserved or un-biased local knowledge of places to see and things to do, there was always someone on hand 24 hrs a day to help us. I have stayed in many top hotels in cities all around the world but found this level of personal service to be quite unique. I would like to thank all the staff who helped make our stay extra special namely, Sinan Erdogan, Ayda, Alper, Emine and the general manager Serkant Kaval. Plus the cleaners, who I didn't see, but even though we once left our room quite late in the day our rooms were still cleaned to pristine condition. I would highly recommend this hotel and will certainly be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Sethu5
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul. The hotel is located at the center of tourist attractions and the room was quite comfortable. The staff led by Mr Sinan Erdogan were courteous, very helpful and knowldegable. Sinan had made arrangemnts for local sight seeing as well and was generous in giving us shopping tips. Our stay was made memorable by the pleasant manners of Sinan and his staff. -- P H Sethuraman, Singapore

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: sultanyacurrant
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay in the Ferman Hotel. I stayed for 4 nights and dont have any complaints. Hotel was very new and the rooms were really nice. Food at breakfast very good and the roof terrace where breakfast was served was fantastic- excellent views over the sea and the Blue Mosque. Location is great-right in the middle of the old town. Staff very professional and really nice- very helpful and pleasant. I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “happy vacation”
Reviews.Author: shadi_shadin
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel big rooms with balcony big terras with a sea view clean rooms with an atractive decoration enjoy ur holiday

Reviews.Title: “We felt like a happy family in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dazzmataz
Reviews.Content: The service and customer service staff was excellent Sly, Alper and the rest made us feel at home, we got unbiased recommendations for clubs, restaurant from the team. I would have to give a 5 star for Cleanliness and service, someone was always their to help and the view from the balcony especially at night is awesome. I will definitely choose this hotel on my next visit to turkey and I will recommend to friends. Darren

Reviews.Title: “great easy stay”
Reviews.Author: tlsstc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights with friends and their baby. Great hotel. The booking process was very easy, Sinon Erdogan, the manager, was very responsive. When we got here the whole staff, especially Sinon, was very helpful with information, reservations, calling restaurants, calling taxis, etc. which was great b/c we were with a baby and don't speak turkish! We were upgraded to better rooms than we originally booked. The hotel is within easy walking distance to all the major sights in Sultanahmet and an easy cab ride to other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: saira1
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel! As soon as we arrived we were greeted with a warm smile from 'Sinan' (front of house manager) he checked us in and provided us with useful information about sultanhamet and the places we might want to visit. The staff are an asset to this hotel and made us feel very welcome and handled all our queries promptly and efficiently- in particular Sinan, Ece and mostafa.-Thanks for a wonderful stay. When we arrived Sinan upgraded us to a penthouse suit, free of charge (room 503) What a wonderful start to a brilliant holiday! The room was beautiful and the views of the blue mosque and the sea were breathtaking. The rooms are decorated to a high standard and are kept Immaculately clean. We had a nice plate of fresh fruit waiting for us, which was nice. Breakfast on the roof top terrace was amazing, imagine having breakfast every morning with wonderful views of the blue mosque, sea and aye sofia. A previous trip advisor recommended the chocolate coffee for breakfast-you were absolutley right it was delicious, i had 2 cups every morning! Location: tourist attractions are within walking distance- Brilliant location- shops, restaurants, blue mosque, aya sofia and topkapi palace are very close by. Useful info: Take a pair of flat comfortable shoes for when you visit the tourist attractions as most streets are brick streets/cobbled and if you wear high heels they might get stuck in the street, as i found out :) - Take some warm clothing for the evening as it can get a bit cool this time of the year. - Exchange most of your currency in Istanbul as you will get a much better rate- theres plenty of exchange places by all the shops - theres a brilliant restaurant literally around the corner from the hotel which does very tasty food so you don't have to walk all the way to the main restaurants to eat. It's called "Sofa Cafe" its good food and it won't break the bank- you can eat in or take out- we decided to take the food back to our hotel one afternoon and eat in on the balcony whilst enjoying the beautiful views -it was lovely. -previous trip advisors have stated that there is a tram station nearby- I am a light sleeper and i slept like a baby on a very comfy bed, i didn't hear anything- so don't be worried about that. - I recommend going on to the roof top tearrace or on your balcony to hear the "azaan" ( call to prayer) It truley is a magical experience Istanbul is an amazing city and staying at this hotel ensured a perfect stay. Thanks to all the staff once again. Wish you all the best!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Historic Hotel in Historic Location”
Reviews.Author: evrenium
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights recently. What can I say? Beautiful classic style hotel in keeping with the local environs. We had a deluxe sea view room and it was very comfortable with a huge bed and real ottomanesque furnishings. The view from the rooftop terrace was of the Blue Mosque - just amazing. Working in the industry I would be happy to offer this hotel to my clients. If you are into large business orintated hotels with loads of facilities then this isn't the place for you ! If you are into hotels of character and charm then look no further ! Well Done Ferman. Thanks for a pleasant, cosy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable hotel, very good position”
Reviews.Author: Ilbibbio
Reviews.Content: We Stay in July 2009 for 1 week. The staff take us at airport, when arrive there and when we came back to return, very good. The Room are very large and the view from our windows was on the marmara see, beautiful. The bed is very confortable and large. The room particulary refined, with style. We like it. The hotel is near Sultanahmet, only few minutes,2 or 3 minutes by walk. From the roof, where we have breakfast the view is magnificient, Haghia Sophia, Blue Moskea,Marmara See , all in a 360Â° view! all the staff is good and carefull to give us good information about the city, the shopping and the pubblic transport. Sinan, the front office manager is great! He told us a lot of thing about visit istanbul and if we return in istanbul sure we stay in this hotel. good location, good service, good staff.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: david973
Reviews.Content: we chose this otel because ferman otel is very nice hotel. staff is friendly people .hotel room hot but very clean

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with great staff in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: kimj100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a just few minutes walk from Sultanahmet Square yet it provides a haven of calm and quiet in the heart of the old city - the perfect base for exploring Istanbul. We stayed in a 'Kings Suite' which was spacious, comfortable and stylish. The large balcony gave great views over the Bosporus and Princes Islands and the dolphins were an added bonus. The staff are all very helpful. In particular, Sinan Erdogan, the manager, was there to arrange/fix/sort anything we needed. Be aware that there is a train track not too far from the back of the hotel and you will get some train noise. That said, it didn't bother us at all and we'll definitely be staying here again. Kim and Kellie Brighton, England

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: JoJo29London
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fab location-really close to the main spots but well away fromt he hustle and bustle. Service was pretty good though one minor complaint to make regarding our check in where our room was changed a couple of times due to twin room/double room confusion by front desk-probably just a one off.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: Englishsolotraveller
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean,sensibly priced, Turkish run small hotel close to the sights of Sultanhamet, this is it. It is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and the Topkapi Palace but away from the crowds down a small cobbled street, close to restaurants and cafes. The view from the rooftop terrace is stunning. The staff here are extremely attentive - nothing too much trouble. The hotel is relatively new so rooms are furnished and decorated to a high standard for this class of hotel. On the downside, the hotel is also close to a suburban railway line, so light sleepers may get a wake up call they had not bargained for! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff; Excellent Service; Beautiful Hotel : Completely Recommended”
Reviews.Author: FadiaCanada
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Ferman Hotel especially Mr. UÄŸur Mutalam, Mr. Murat Bicici & Mr. Sly Erdogan are very welcoming and go out of their way to assist you. They are very friendly and helpful; they are experts at recommending places to visit in Old Istanbul. They treat you more than a guest at their hotel; they make you feel like family. The hotel is very clean and strategically placed close to some of the best restaurants, the blue mosque, and many of the other important tourist places to visit. It has a beautiful roof top terrace with an exceptional view. There is a train track buit next to the hotel so if you are a light sleeper, you might not enjoy that too much. However, the hotel is supreme in everything it has to offer. The staff works extremely hard at pleasing all their customers. This hotel is the hotel of choice for me when I go visit Istanbul. I am always thankful at the amazing service I received in Istanbul. Again, my greatest thanks to Mr. UÄŸur Mutalam, Mr. Murat Bicici & Mr. Sly Erdogan.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable information and support”
Reviews.Author: stefses
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend to anyone wishing to visit Istanbul, and wanting to contact somebody reliable, friendly and honest, to contact Sinan at [--] or email [--]. Sinan Erdogan has been a great help to me during the past 3 years to find accommodation in good areas, reasonably priced and very pleasant. Wish all the best of success to Sinan, Giovanni V.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Wethersfield
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't be more centrally placed for anyone visiting Istanbul for the first time city break, and wanting to see the major sites. It has a stunning roof terrace where you take breakfast, with an unrivalled view of the Blue Mosque inland, and the Sea of Marmara and the entrance to the Bosphorus to sea. Staff are charming and anxious to help. Railway is very close at the back and might inconvenience the very light sleeper, and there are one or two little things like a slightly leaking shower that the management need to fix, but you won't find a more conveniently placed hotel for Sultanahmet

Reviews.Title: “Great starting point for enjoying Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: azeriannie
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a fabulous location, staff who try hard to please and a very relaxed atmosphere. This was our third stay in the Ferman and it's our hotel of choice for Old Istanbul. Its in a quiet road behind the Blue Mosque, but only a minute from some great restaurants and bars. The rooms are spacious and perfectly adequate for an Istanbul visit and the rooftop terrace gives you a great view of both Sultanahmet and the Sea of Marmara. The best rooms are on the top floor and ours was comfortable with a large balcony overlooking the Mosque. You get woken by the early morning Call to Prayer, but that just reminds you you're on holiday and having a great time. Good value too.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, good manager and good staff especially Mr. Sinan Erdogan.”
Reviews.Author: aliabbas
Reviews.Content: my stay has encouraged me to look forward to come back to turkey . the staff are very excellent. the hotel looks as if it is five starshotel with its deluxe rooms. my sincere thanks to all the staff for their good service, especially the manager and MR. Sinan Erdogan. Faithfully Yours,, Ali Abbas

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, kind staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: necahn
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in Istanbul, Hotel Ferman, where we have stayed with our one year old son. If you need a very good hotel, with nice, comfortable and clean room, good restaurant and perfect location - you will like Ferman hotel. We had a Sultan's room, and even there is not a view to the all Blue Mosque, it is excellent. From the window, you can see just a top of a minaret, and little lovely street which is very nice an quite. Windows are very good, so if you want your perfect silence, it's enough to close it. You will hear nothing, but we loved to hear muezzin from Mosque. There is nice bathroom, and clean towels every day. Room was very clean, and it looks luxury. Hotel is located very close to Blue Mosque and Aja Sofia, so it's a very good choice for us who wants to visit historical monuments. It's on a walk distance from Yerbatan Cistern or Grand Bazaar (Capali Carsi). We also had a very good experience with staff there, and we have a many nice words about Sinan and Murat who were there for us in any time, boy who helped us with our baggage, and who prepared a bed for our baby, and waiter Adnan, who is very kind person, ready to help in any moment. Thank you! Istanbul is wonderful city, and we hope we'll come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelman033
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a 4 night pre cruise visit from Istanbul. The hotel provides a trouble free taxi service for stays over 4 nights . Reception was welcoming and helpful. They mentioned trips available but did not push them which was unusual for Istanbul. The room and bathroom was clean and comfortable. A small railway runs along the back of the hotel but trains were infrequent and did not disturb us in any way. The new roof terrace was about to be opened. I recommend going up there for the late call to prayer when you can hear all the mosques echoing round the city. Quite magical. Our room lacked drawer space but for just a few nights it did not matter. There was adequate AC but also the windows opened wide which was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, views and service”
Reviews.Author: JamGulAustralia
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I was looking for. This hotel has great views from the dining area (on the roof) and was close to all the attractions. The staff were great and very friendly. I will definitely stay here if I (hopefully) go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely breathtaking views and service to match!”
Reviews.Author: MancunianX43
Reviews.Content: What an amazing holiday, the location is spot on - it is central yet without all the commotion and noise (however there is the suburban train track running at the back of hotel although it was not a problem for our 6-month old who was not inconvenienced by the trains). The rooms in the hotel were of a good size. My wife and I travelled with our 6 month old son for a week to Istanbul. We booked the Sultan suite however on checking-in, we were told that some ants had been sighted in the room because of food left by the previous occupants and were asked if we would consider sleeping in the Ferman suite that night and that we would be upgraded to the Ocean's suite for the duration of our stay. So we had the opportunity of view 3 types of room. The ferman room was in the lower ground floor facing the street as opposed to the sea and was somewhat smaller than the Sultan room. The main difference was the size of the room, lack of balcony and a shower in lieu of a bath and shower. The Ocean room has a breathtaking view (See pics!). Breakfast on the roof terrace first thing was a delight. There are unobstructed views of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. The rooms were very clean and the staff made the stay all the more enjoyable, especially Sinan and the lady at reception whose name I can't remember. No request was too much trouble for them and everything was done with a smile.I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful service, perfect view!”
Reviews.Author: killemom
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel experience I have evere had! The hotel is so beautyful, the staff so very friendly, we felt like queens. I had asked for a room with seperate beds, and we got a free upgrade because they didt have seperate beds in the category we had booked. The room was very spacious, we could have a royal ball in there! Breakfast overlooking the marmara sea and blue mosque was not bad either! Only a few minutes walk from "everything". I am sure I will be back some day :-)

Reviews.Title: “A diamond!”
Reviews.Author: UandCandV
Reviews.Content: We visited several hotels in Sultanamet before we found this diamond - Ferman Hotel is outstanding! Nice staff, fantastic wiev from the top terass, nicely decorated rooms and perfectly clean - everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...great view...great room...great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: peta4meter
Reviews.Content: The Ferman may have the very best unobstructed, rooftop view of the Blue Mosque -- day and night! My husband and I stayed here four nights the last week of July 2009 and loved it...loved Istanbul...loved everything Turkey. I even loved the 4:30 am call to prayer...I considered it a lullaby; my husband got used to it. We had a room on the street side. It is a very quiet street generally...it is just two blocks from the street filled with restaurants of various price ranges and offerings. We walked everywhere --- you are within blocks of the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sophia, the Palace, Hippodrome, Roman cistern (what an amazing place that is!), the tram to take you to other places including across the river to Taxim. We felt perfectly safe walking through the area at night -- oh, the Blue Mosque is magical at night! And there are lots of people out enjoying themselves. The hotel is new construction, so the rooms and fixtures are lovely. We also enjoyed having a Turkish delight or cookie each time we walked through the lobby. And the staff, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AJALondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Ferman hotel in 2 rooms (standard twin and ocean room). Both rooms were very spacious and clean, the ocean room had a lovely sea view. Breakfast was on a newly built beautiful roof terrace with excellent views of blue mosque and aya sofia. The hotel is in a great location in the old city, only 5 minutes walk to the main historical sights. All the staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. I would wholeheartedly reccommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay there again if I go back to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of tourist Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: miss_rambler
Reviews.Content: Ferman Hotel is located on a side street in the heart of touristy Sultanahmet. This area has a strip of hotels and restaurants catering to tourists. For those who wish to stay in a more neighbourhood-like part of Istanbul, this is not for them but for us, this was perfect (5 min walk to Haghia Sophia, Topkapi, Blue Mosque). The room (Sultan's Room) was lovely, with a small balcony overlooking the side street of the hotel. Everything was clean and comfortable and air conditioning was welcomed in the intense heat. Our only qualm was with the minibar fridge which was very dirty and didn't seem to fit in with the rest of the level of care of the room and hotel. Other reviewers mention the breakfast being disappointing. Please note that when we stayed there the breakfast had moved to the roof, with a nice relaxing vibe, beautiful views of the city and decent food.

Reviews.Title: “cosy hotel - ok location”
Reviews.Author: CorruptedSanity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 2 nights late April 2009. The hotel location was ok, about 10 minutes of walking to Sultan Ahmet Mosque. The hotel is not on a busy street, in fact it is right of off a busy street with plenty of restaurants and shops. The interior was decorated nicely and is evident that it is either new or recently renovated. Our room had a little balcony that had views of the sea which was really nice. A negative would be the noise from the train that passed by approximately every hour. Breakfast was served in the basement, so not the best ambiance as there were no windows or open area. The food was ordinary, nothing special. Hotel staff were excellent, I must commend Sinan and Durdane for their utmost help.

Reviews.Title: “I Love the People of Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Johntheceot
Reviews.Content: Our Stay was fantastic from start to finish. This is a great location for us to see what we wanted. We were offered to go to the seaside but as we live by the seaside in Australia so we wanted to experieance what Istanbul had to offer. I absolutely loved the Turkish people they are caring extremly friendly and fun loving people. We built a bond with all staff but a young beautiful young lady was Durdane (Ece) Acar the hotels best asset. She was so good to us and she had a wonderful sense of humour and was a very lovely person. Seeing her each day was a joy we were sad to leave her behind. What a great asset to your Hotel. Funny story:Before heading off to a cafe one night a Japanese hotel guest with an american accent runs in panicing as her boyfriend has been attacked by a cat. I asked "how big was this wild animal" "It is a little baby cat " she says> We found this very funny but she was worried he may get rabies.He lived!! Highly recommend staff and position of this hotel. A magnicicent view from the roof top area. Good spot for seeing everything. This is located in old Istanbul. We built friendships that will last for ever. Thank you ECE Acar for looking after us if you ever get to see this John Hart Australia. johntheceo@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, excellent location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: whozlost
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at this excellent hotel which is close to all the main tourist attractions. We had a large room which was very well furnished and had a view of the Bosphorus form its own small balcony. Breakfast was excellent and was served in a large room on the lower floor, however once the the roof terrace is finished you will be able eat while having amazing views of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and the Bosphorus. The hotel was beautifully clean and the staff were extremely friendly - a special mention must go to Sinan on the front desk who was particularly helpful . We would definitely stay at the Ferman again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, accomodation and location first class. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: angelpeak-photo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay at the Ferman. This is a first class hotel with the most friendly and helpful staff we have ever met. Our room on the top floor, with an unobstructed view over the Bosphorus from the private veranda, was spacious, very comfortable and well furnished. The location is first class and being only minutes away from all the main attractions and restaurants etc in the Sultanahmet area. The staff are quite exceptional and work very hard to ensure everything is to your satisfaction. In the hotel reception Ece always had a smile and nothing asked of her was too much! All in all a clean and modern hotel, staffed by exceptional people. We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ardementozo
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife and two freinds stayed at this hotel for four nights in early May. We were impressed of the way the hotel was decorated (home feeling), location of the hotel, high quality & down to earth services of the hotel staff. Ece & Adnan were particularly helpful and active like honey bees. The breakfast served was fresh and enough to energize you for the day!. Rooms were very comfortable and spotlessly cleen!, spacious. I would defnitely stay there again if I come to Istanbul once more and would highly recommend it to my freinds and all travellers wishing to experience a great homestay!

Reviews.Title: “we had a very pleasant experience at this comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Victor29
Reviews.Content: My daughter booked this hotel for her father's birthday treat and it came up to all expectations. The hotel was very clean and comfortable, The Breakfast was very good with lots of choice. Our room had a nice view of the Blue Mosque and when the roof terrace is finished I am sure the views will be even better. The Staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is situated in an ideal spot for sightseeing with plenty of choices for eating out at prices lower than those in the main centre.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Nate98
Reviews.Content: We spend 3 nights at the Ferman in mid-May. The hotel was a great refuge from the bustle of the city at the end of the day. The staff was wonderfully helpful, particularly Adnan, who did everything from recommending particular cheeses at breakfast to helping with our bags when we left. The room was surprisingly large and quiet. Although the location was a little farther from the Sultanahmet's main sights and the tramline than other hotels we stayed in, it was a pretty short walk (~7 minutes) to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, etc. We would definitely consider the Ferman again our next time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianStPetersburg
Reviews.Content: My wife & I recently stayed at the Ferman Hotel for 11 nights. Although at the time there was some work being done on the new terrace roof it, did not disturb our stay. The hotel has been refurbished inside to an excellent standard. We stayed six(6) nights in the â€˜Ferman Roomâ€™ and then five(5) nights in one of the top floor â€˜Suitesâ€™. Both rooms were of a very high standard. The Suite had wonderful views of the Marmara Sea & City. The Manager Sinan and his staff could not have been more helpful. They arranged transport to and from the airport as well as transporting us to a local â€˜Fishâ€™ restaurant one evening. Just one note of caution, there is a railway line running along the back of the hotel, but bearing in mind that this is a lively city with calls to prayer five times a day the noise from the trains can be blocked out as the windows are double glazed & the room has air conditioning. Breakfast was very good, and Iâ€™m sure when the roof terrace is completed it will be a wonderful place to start your day! Already we are passing on the details of the Ferman Hotel to family and friends, and will happily return in the future. Thanks again Sinan to you & all your staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing if you just ask!”
Reviews.Author: amirhassanm
Reviews.Content: We (a couple and our little girl) stayed in Ferman Hotel during early May for 6 nights and we are indeed satisfied of our hotel. Location: Perfect! Very close to all important touristic sites. Only five minutes to Sultan Ahmet Square. Close to Transportation system (both tram and suburban Train). In the middle of everything but very Quiet. Rooms: We stayed at "Ocean" room with a nice view of Marmara sea and Princess islands. The room was big, well decorated and clean. The "Sultan" rooms also are big and "Ferman" rooms are smaller but still can not be called as small room. Our room had e safety deposite box and a very nice sofa bed. We didnt ask for an extra bed for our baby because sofa bed was enough big and comfortable. Windows are insulated well so no problem with noise. Southern rooms (Particularly Ocean rooms) are near to suburban train railway but as much as windows are close no problem with noise. I should add that rooms are facilitated by a nice aircon. system which is totally under your control. It is possible to change the mode to "cool" or "warm", change the temperature and adjust the fan by a remote control exists in each room so you dont need to open the windows. the bed was comfortable. Each bed has four pillows; Two big and two small. Bathroom is realy clean and spotless, facilitated by a good size bathtub, high pressure shower and a telephone. The only drawback about rooms is that you can hear the sound of fan and water from your neighbours bathroom. Although nothing can be heared from next rooms (TV, speaking etc.) only bathroom. Staff: are realy helpful. You just ask and you will have what you have asked for. If you needed anything please ask Sinan. He will do his best to provide you with that. Once I asked how I can provide an akbil and he gave me his own Akbil and let us use it all the period of our staying. I asked for an extra blanket for my kid and had it immediately. Many times he asked us if we need anything or are satisfied. "Ece" is also very nice and always welcome you with a smile and cause you do not hesitate if you want to ask sth. Breakfast room is managed by a very kind man (unfortunately I forgot the name). I had read some complaints about hotel in two of previous reviews but I did not face any of them. Once we asked for tea in our room and we entertaied with no charge.There was no instruction for safety deposit box and aircon. remote control in room but as soon as we arrived I asked for instruction and I trained well. . Both were easy. I didnt face problem with corridor light or cold water in bathroom. Just once Our key didnt work and they fixed it as soon as possible.It shows that they did try to fix previous problems. The hotel is new and staff are young and wishful. You might face some little problems which is because of their lack of experience but if you did, only ask them to fix it and they will do that for you. Breakfast is good but now serves in bottomfloor. The rooftop terrace was under constraction and will be opened in june. that was the only thing that made us sad. Finally. I do recommend this hotel to others especially after opening the rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: readheadMonmouth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not particularly striking from the outside but has recently been totally refurbished inside to an excellent standard. Our room was large with an amazing view of the Blue Mosque. The receptionist and staff could not have been more helpful. The receptionist booked transport to and from the airport and a river cruise for us, all of which worked like clockwork. The breakfast room is in the basement and relatively small but the breakfast provided was very good with plenty of choice. The room was never overcrowded. The manager also helped find a restaurant for the evening and their are plenty of good eating places within a very short distance. We found walking to the major attractions very easy from this hotel. We will certainly recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “My opinion about ferman hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: KarinaFranke
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Ferman Hotel 3 nights everthing was magnificent for us .I and my friend booked Ocean Room.It has sea view as metion on its name and room decoration was superb.I feel like Ottoman House which breath past and now. Ferman Hotel located near town center ,you can go on your foot (walking distance ) 5 min.Sultanahmet Mosque and Hagia Sofia are very near also Grand Bazaar.Also receptions are very helpfull about everthing .You can feel on your house .They treat you like king or queens.Especially Ece who is reception .She is very warm-hearted and always smiling .When I turn back my country she also send mail which asking our trip and flight(how was it) .I desire to see them in our country .I invited them namely. The breakfast was excellent .Service ,staff ,hotel ,place so superb .I wanna to thank them everthing during our holiday. And I want to share my experience .Finally only they have problem about red carpet in front of the hotel all the time they need to clean.Also I went a Restorant which offer from the reception name of Kalamar.It is also wonderful.It is located marketing fish area.I recommend this hotel insistly.Thank you for them hospitaly =)

Reviews.Title: “FERMAN HOTEL IS EXCELLENT !”
Reviews.Author: czilbo
Reviews.Content: I am just arriving from my stay of 7 nights at Istanbul.It was absolutely great.Ferman Hotel is a very special place.Rooms are very very confortable, clean and location is very nice.But I have to stress that staff is really wonderful Sinan and Ece (and also Murad and the waiter) were great, making all the best for us to fell at home.I really recommend Ferman Hotel in Istanbul and hope to stay there again in a very short time!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel ! !”
Reviews.Author: chesterlin
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I stayed 5 nights (from Apr. 17 to 22, 2009) in this â€œFerman Hotelâ€�. The location of the hotel is superb. It only takes about 5-10 min. walk to not only the tourist must-see spots, ie. the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia but also the metro station where you can access anywhere you want. Yet the hotel gets you away from the clamour of the crowds. If you are lucky to stay on one side of the hotel, you can overlook the Marmara Sea with the occasional train passing by. Itâ€™s a newly opened hotel. It looks dainty and cozy. We were told itâ€™s just been started for 7 months then. Obviously, itâ€™s running by a group of decent, enterprising young people. We received their kind hospitality while we stayed there. We took a night flight on the day we left. The check out time of the hotel was noon 12 PM . Our luggage was left in the reception area. Because my hubby needed to use the internet, without any doubt, Sinan, who had the same name as a famous Turkish architect, (I think he, who had an artistic hair-do, is the chief executive!) opened a new, spare room for my hubby to use the internet until the car picked us up to go to the airport in the night time. We deeply appreciated his kind generosity! We strongly recommend someone who wants to pay a reasonable price for comfy accommodation as well as being so close to famous tourist spots. This is the place !

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mercilia
Reviews.Content: We had just returned from Ferman Hotel and all I can tell you is that it was one of the best hotels I ever stayed.The staff (Ece, Sinan and Murad) are wonderful and made all efforts to make us at home. The rooms are excellent and location is absolutely perfect.Thank you for everything

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: AdemDuran
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ferman Hotel 4 Nights it was a great birthday treat from my wife who had booked the hotel, she couldnt have picked anything better. This was are first visit to Istanbul so the location of the hotel couldn't be any better for the first time travellers. The room was clean and spacious with brilliant decor. The hotel like others have mentioned has small adjustment to be made however this shouldn't hold anyone back from booking it. The breakfast room is in the basement and yes its a little boring but its continental breakfast and this is how all continental breakfast taste, but when they finish the rooftop terrace i think it will be up lifting the breakfast with some amazing views of Istanbul. The staff at Ferman hotel likes of SInan (Duty Manager) Ece, Adnan and anyone else that we have forgot the names of have been fantastic. They have made shored that we have a great time at their Hotel and in Istanbul. Guys we will be back...... Overall i would recommend this hotel to all friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel with some teething problems”
Reviews.Author: PaulJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well decorated and well located. Room finishing is also good with comfortable beds and nice linen. Breakfast is served in the "basement" in a partially unfinished room and is only OK but nothing special. The close proximity of the railway line can also be noisy for "ocean view" rooms. Some teething problems: 1) No instructions in room on how to set the code on the safe, what number to dial for reception etc. 2) Although the staff at reception is very friendly they are not always helpful - I think the English language barrier is a problem. 3) Toilet paper and toiletries always seemed to be in short supply and not always replaced. 4) No hot water in bathroom one morning - had a cold shower at 06:00 before leaving for an Ephesus day trip. 5) Motion sensor lights in passages are annoying as the delay is too short. 6) Room key card not available on arrival and not working when first issued. 7) Numerous requests to repair leaking toilet. In general a good experience but some small detail things need attention.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandBarbara81
Reviews.Content: We visited the Ferman for 3 nights and had a terrific time. The hotel is very clean and the room we had had the most fantastic view and an enormous comfortable bed. The staff (Ece ad Sinan in particular) were very friendly but didn't intrude. The hotel is very new so the decor is not complete in some areas, I look forward to returning in future to see it all finished. I would highly recommend this hotel. Everything we wanted to see was on the doorstep and the hotel itself was a real sanctuary after a longday sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Evistar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights on our first trip to Istanbul. The hotel was newly redone, spacious, well decorated room and nice bathroom. All very clean. Great location for sightseeing, 3 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque. Central but quiet at the same time. Some rail raod tracks nearby made us nervous at first but it was not an issue. Breakfast was plenty and good. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I got ill one night eating some excotic appetizer (not at the hotel!) and everyone made sure I had everything needed in these dire circumstances! The terrace was still under construction but it was rather cool during our stay so we did not miss it. The site which I used to book the hotel, had included a bar in the descpription. It did not exist but they were some nice bars within one minute walk with views over the Bosporus. Overall, if you are visiting Istanbul with some serious sightseeing in mind - Ferman is a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: jaimecuesta78
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time, the room were completely cozy with huge beds and very new and clean furniture. It's totally worth it staying there.
